### ◊†◊™◊†◊ô◊î◊ï ◊ë◊í◊ë◊ï◊ú ◊î◊¶◊§◊ï◊ü: "◊í◊ù ◊õ◊ê◊ü ◊†◊©◊ô◊í ◊†◊ô◊¶◊ó◊ï◊ü, ◊ú◊ê ◊§◊ó◊ï◊™ ◊û◊ñ◊î"

◊®◊ê◊© ◊î◊û◊û◊©◊ú◊î ◊ë◊†◊ô◊û◊ô◊ü ◊†◊™◊†◊ô◊î◊ï ◊§◊í◊© ◊ê◊™◊û◊ï◊ú (◊©◊ú◊ô◊©◊ô) ◊ê◊™ ◊ú◊ï◊ó◊û◊ô ◊ï◊û◊§◊ß◊ì◊ô ◊¢◊ï◊¶◊ë◊™ ◊¥◊ó◊ï◊ì ◊î◊ó◊†◊ô◊™◊¥ (◊ó◊ò◊ô◊ë◊î 55), ◊ë◊¢◊ô◊¶◊ï◊û◊ï ◊©◊ú ◊™◊®◊í◊ô◊ú ◊ó◊ò◊ô◊ë◊™◊ô ◊ë◊û◊™◊ï◊ï◊î ◊¶◊§◊ï◊†◊ô ◊©◊û◊™◊ß◊ô◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊í◊ú◊ô◊ú. ◊î◊™◊®◊í◊ô◊ú ◊û◊î◊ï◊ï◊î ◊ó◊ú◊ß ◊û◊°◊ì◊®◊™ ◊™◊®◊í◊ô◊ú◊ô◊ù ◊©◊û◊ë◊¶◊¢◊ô◊ù ◊ó◊ò◊ô◊ë◊ï◊™ ◊®◊ë◊ï◊™ ◊ë◊¶◊î"◊ú ◊ú◊î◊í◊ë◊®◊™ ◊õ◊©◊ô◊®◊ï◊™ ◊ï◊™◊ô◊ß◊ï◊£ ◊î◊™◊õ◊†◊ô◊ï◊™ ◊ú◊û◊™◊ß◊§◊î ◊ë◊ú◊ë◊†◊ï◊ü.

◊†◊™◊†◊ô◊î◊ï ◊ë◊í◊ë◊ï◊ú ◊î◊¶◊§◊ï◊ü ◊¶◊ô◊ú◊ï◊ù: ◊®◊ï◊¢◊ô ◊ê◊ë◊®◊î◊ù / ◊ú◊¢"◊û

◊®◊ê◊© ◊î◊û◊û◊©◊ú◊î ◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ú ◊°◊ß◊ô◊®◊î ◊û◊û◊§◊ß◊ì ◊§◊ô◊ß◊ï◊ì ◊î◊¶◊§◊ï◊ü ◊ê◊ú◊ï◊£ ◊ê◊ï◊®◊ô ◊í◊ï◊®◊ì◊ô◊ü ◊ï◊û◊û◊§◊ß◊ì◊ô ◊î◊ó◊ò◊ô◊ë◊î ◊ï◊î◊í◊ì◊ï◊ì◊ô◊ù ◊¢◊ú ◊¢◊©◊ô◊ô◊™ ◊ú◊ï◊ó◊û◊ô ◊î◊¶◊†◊ó◊†◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊û◊ô◊ú◊ï◊ê◊ô◊ù, ◊©◊ú◊ß◊ó◊ï ◊ó◊ú◊ß ◊ë◊õ◊ú ◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊ï◊™ ◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú ◊ï◊†◊ú◊ó◊û◊ï ◊û◊°◊§◊® ◊ó◊ï◊ì◊©◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊ì◊®◊ï◊ù ◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î. ◊î◊û◊§◊ß◊ì◊ô◊ù ◊î◊ë◊ô◊¢◊ï ◊ë◊ê◊ï◊§◊ü ◊ó◊ì ◊û◊©◊û◊¢◊ô ◊ê◊™ ◊†◊ó◊ô◊©◊ï◊™◊ù ◊ï◊û◊ï◊õ◊†◊ï◊™◊ù ◊ú◊î◊û◊©◊ö ◊ú◊ó◊ô◊û◊î ◊¢◊¶◊ô◊û◊î ◊ë◊õ◊ú ◊û◊®◊ó◊ë ◊ï◊ñ◊û◊ü ◊©◊ô◊ì◊®◊©◊ï ◊ú◊õ◊ö.¬†

◊®◊ê◊© ◊î◊û◊û◊©◊ú◊î ◊†◊™◊†◊ô◊î◊ï ◊ë◊™◊ï◊ù ◊î◊ë◊ô◊ß◊ï◊®: "◊ê◊†◊ô ◊§◊î ◊¢◊ù ◊ó◊ò◊ô◊ë◊î 55, ◊ó◊ò◊ô◊ë◊™ ◊¥◊ó◊ï◊ì ◊î◊ó◊†◊ô◊™". ◊™◊®◊í◊ô◊ú ◊ó◊ò◊ô◊ë◊™◊ô ◊û◊ê◊ï◊ì ◊û◊®◊©◊ô◊ù, ◊ë◊ô◊õ◊ï◊ú◊ï◊™, ◊ë◊î◊™◊í◊ô◊ô◊°◊ï◊™, ◊ë◊î◊™◊ô◊ô◊¶◊ë◊ï◊™, ◊ë◊õ◊ï◊©◊® ◊î◊ë◊ô◊¶◊ï◊¢. ◊õ◊ï◊©◊® ◊ë◊ô◊¶◊ï◊¢ ◊í◊ì◊ï◊ú ◊û◊ê◊ï◊ì ◊©◊ú ◊î◊ó◊ô◊ô◊ú◊ô◊ù ◊ï◊î◊û◊§◊ß◊ì◊ô◊ù ◊©◊ë◊ê◊ô◊ù ◊û◊õ◊ú ◊ó◊ú◊ß◊ô ◊î◊ê◊®◊•, ◊û◊õ◊ú ◊ó◊ú◊ß◊ô ◊î◊ó◊ë◊®◊î ◊î◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú◊ô◊™. ◊î◊ù ◊†◊ó◊ï◊©◊ô◊ù ◊ï◊ì◊ë◊ß◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊û◊©◊ô◊û◊î - ◊ú◊î◊í◊ü ◊¢◊ú ◊î◊û◊ì◊ô◊†◊î ◊ï◊ú◊î◊©◊ô◊í ◊†◊ô◊¶◊ó◊ï◊ü, ◊ú◊ê ◊§◊ó◊ï◊™ ◊û◊ñ◊î".

◊ë◊ë◊ô◊ß◊ï◊® ◊î◊©◊™◊™◊§◊ï ◊®◊≥ ◊î◊°◊í◊ú, ◊î◊û◊ñ◊õ◊ô◊® ◊î◊¶◊ë◊ê◊ô ◊©◊ú ◊®◊î◊¥◊û ◊ê◊ú◊ï◊£ ◊®◊ï◊û◊ü ◊í◊ï◊§◊û◊ü, ◊û◊§◊ß◊ì ◊§◊ô◊ß◊ï◊ì ◊¶◊§◊ï◊ü ◊ê◊ú◊ï◊£ ◊ê◊ï◊®◊ô ◊í◊ï◊®◊ì◊ô◊ü, ◊û◊§◊ß◊ì ◊û◊ú◊¥◊ô ◊™◊ê◊¥◊ú ◊ß◊ï◊ë◊ô ◊î◊ú◊®, ◊û◊ó◊¥◊ò 55 ◊ê◊ú◊¥◊ù ◊¢◊ï◊ì◊ì ◊ñ◊ô◊û◊ü ◊ï◊û◊§◊ß◊ì◊ô ◊î◊í◊ì◊ï◊ì◊ô◊ù.

### ◊í◊ú◊†◊ò ◊ë◊ë◊ô◊™ ◊î◊ú◊ë◊ü - ◊ë◊ë◊ô◊ß◊ï◊®◊™ ◊¢◊ú ◊†◊™◊†◊ô◊î◊ï: "◊í◊ù ◊õ◊ê◊©◊® ◊ê◊†◊ï ◊ó◊ú◊ï◊ß◊ô◊ù ◊¢◊ú ◊î◊ì◊®◊ö, ◊ê◊†◊ó◊†◊ï ◊§◊ï◊™◊®◊ô◊ù ◊ñ◊ê◊™ ◊ë◊ó◊ì◊®◊ô◊ù ◊î◊°◊í◊ï◊®◊ô◊ù"

**◊©◊® ◊î◊ë◊ô◊ò◊ó◊ï◊ü ◊í◊ú◊†◊ò ◊ë◊ë◊ô◊™ ◊î◊ú◊ë◊ü: "◊î◊û◊ò◊®◊ï◊™ ◊ï◊î◊ô◊¢◊ì◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊î ◊û◊©◊ï◊™◊§◊ô◊ù ◊ú◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú ◊ï◊ê◊®◊î"◊ë, ◊í◊ù ◊õ◊ê◊©◊® ◊ê◊†◊ï ◊ó◊ú◊ï◊ß◊ô◊ù ◊¢◊ú ◊î◊ì◊®◊ö ◊ê◊†◊ó◊†◊ï ◊§◊ï◊™◊®◊ô◊ù ◊ñ◊ê◊™ ◊ë◊ó◊ì◊®◊ô◊ù ◊î◊°◊í◊ï◊®◊ô◊ù - ◊õ◊¢◊™ ◊ê◊†◊ó◊†◊ï ◊û◊°◊õ◊û◊ô◊ù ◊ê◊™ ◊î◊ì◊ë◊®◊ô◊ù"**

◊©◊® ◊î◊ë◊ô◊ò◊ó◊ï◊ü ◊ô◊ï◊ê◊ë ◊í◊ú◊†◊ò ◊†◊§◊í◊© ◊õ◊¢◊™ (◊®◊ë◊ô◊¢◊ô) ◊¢◊ù ◊î◊ô◊ï◊¢◊• ◊ú◊ë◊ô◊ò◊ó◊ï◊ü ◊ú◊ê◊ï◊û◊ô ◊©◊ú ◊ê◊®◊î"◊ë ◊í◊≥◊ô◊ô◊ß ◊°◊ê◊ú◊ô◊ë◊ü ◊ë◊ë◊ô◊™ ◊î◊ú◊ë◊ü.¬†

◊î◊©◊® ◊í◊ú◊†◊ò ◊ê◊û◊® ◊ë◊§◊™◊ó ◊î◊§◊í◊ô◊©◊î: "◊ê◊†◊ô ◊†◊õ◊†◊° ◊õ◊¢◊™ ◊ú◊§◊í◊ô◊©◊î ◊¢◊ù ◊î◊ô◊ï◊¢◊• ◊ú◊ë◊ô◊ò◊ó◊ï◊ü ◊ú◊ê◊ï◊û◊ô ◊í'◊ô◊ô◊ß ◊°◊ê◊ú◊ô◊ë◊ü ◊ë◊ë◊ô◊™ ◊î◊ú◊ë◊ü, ◊¢◊ú ◊û◊†◊™ ◊ú◊ì◊ï◊ü ◊õ◊§◊ô ◊©◊ô◊ì◊ô◊ì◊ô◊ù ◊ì◊†◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊°◊ì◊®◊î ◊ê◊®◊ï◊õ◊î ◊©◊ú ◊ì◊ë◊®◊ô◊ù - ◊ú◊ë◊†◊ï◊ü, ◊¢◊ñ◊î, ◊ê◊ô◊®◊ê◊ü, ◊î◊†◊ï◊©◊ê◊ô◊ù ◊î◊ß◊©◊ï◊®◊ô◊ù ◊ê◊ú◊ô◊î◊ù ◊ï◊í◊ù ◊†◊ï◊©◊ê ◊î◊ê◊°◊§◊ß◊î ◊î◊ê◊û◊®◊ô◊ß◊ê◊ô◊™ ◊ú◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú◊¥.¬†

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from bhol.co.il contains the exact image <image:39>. The article is about the situation in Lebanon and the alert in Heshmonaim. The article was updated on June 26, 2024. The article also mentions an attack in Nabatieh, Lebanon, and the call of Germany and the Netherlands for their citizens to leave Lebanon. The article also contains an image of an attack in Nabatieh <image:721925>.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Web Sources
**Reverse Search Result** The exact image was found in the following sources:

From [Source](https://today.lorientlejour.com/article/1418485/israeli-strike-on-nabatieh-at-least-7-injured-and-14-suffocated.html): Found exact image on website with title: Residents in Nabatieh 'frightened' but determined to 'stay' after ...
Content: The search result from L'Orient Today shows the exact image <image:39> and reports on an Israeli strike on Nabatieh, Lebanon, on June 26, 2024, which injured nine people. The article mentions the building was completely destroyed. The article is dated June 27, 2024.


From [Source](https://www.bhol.co.il/news/1666411): Found exact image on website with title: ◊ê◊ñ◊¢◊ß◊î ◊†◊©◊û◊¢◊î ◊ë◊ó◊©◊û◊ï◊†◊ê◊ô◊ù | ◊û◊ì◊ô◊†◊ï◊™ ◊ß◊ï◊®◊ê◊ï◊™ ◊ú◊ê◊ñ◊®◊ó◊ô◊î◊ü ◊ú◊¢◊ñ◊ï◊ë ◊ê◊™ ◊ú◊ë◊†◊ï◊ü
Content: The search result from bhol.co.il contains the exact image <image:39>. The article is about the situation in Lebanon and the alert in Heshmonaim. The article was updated on June 26, 2024. The article also mentions an attack in Nabatieh, Lebanon, and the call of Germany and the Netherlands for their citizens to leave Lebanon. The article also contains an image of an attack in Nabatieh <image:721925>.

## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image <image:39>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:39>

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. More information is needed to determine the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:39>

## Elaboration
The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. More information is needed to determine the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The reverse image search did not provide any results, making it impossible to verify the claim. The lack of information about the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it prevents a conclusion.

`not enough information`

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand‚Äôs new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:39>

## Elaboration
The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. More information is needed to determine the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it.


# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("Deir al-Balah Gaza bombing March 2025")
image_search("bombing Deir al-Balah Gaza")
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:39>

## Elaboration
The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. More information is needed to determine the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it.


## Actions
```
web_search("Deir al-Balah Gaza bombing March 2025")
image_search("bombing Deir al-Balah Gaza")
```

Part of the [Gaza‚ÄìIsrael conflict](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "Gaza‚ÄìIsrael conflict")

, and the [Middle Eastern crisis (2023‚Äìpresent)](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023‚Äìpresent)")

Courts

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Global courts | *   [_South Africa v. A few days later, Israel cut off the electricity supply to Gaza Strip's main desalination plant, which provided drinking water for 500,000 Palestinians.[\[42\]](#cite_note-43)
 [Amnesty International](/wiki/Amnesty_International "Amnesty International")
 said that shutting off all food and water indicated Israel had a policy of imposing conditions of life calculated to bring about the destruction of the Palestinian people ‚Äì which is [tantamount to genocide](/wiki/Genocidal_intent "Genocidal intent")
.[\[17\]](#cite_note-Amnesty20250310-17)
[\[18\]](#cite_note-JordanTimes20250310-18)
 [M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res](/wiki/M%C3%A9decins_Sans_Fronti%C3%A8res "M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res")
 said depriving Palestinians of drinking water was a [war crime](/wiki/War_crime "War crime")
.[\[16\]](#cite_note-Mahase2025-16)
[\[18\]](#cite_note-JordanTimes20250310-18)

On 17 and 18 March, Israeli officials stated that Palestinian militants, including Hamas, were building up their military capabilities and preparing for offensives against Israeli communities and [Israeli](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 soldiers in Gaza.[\[43\]](#cite_note-44)
 Israel did not provide any evidence for these claims.[\[28\]](#cite_note-PBS20250318-28)
 Hamas denied these allegations.[\[28\]](#cite_note-PBS20250318-28)

### Israeli domestic politics

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faced pressure from [far-right](/wiki/Far-right_politics_in_Israel "Far-right politics in Israel")
 members of his coalition to resume war against the Gaza Strip.[\[28\]](#cite_note-PBS20250318-28)
 Throughout the war, members of Netanyahu's coalition have called for the permanent conquest of Gaza and re-establishment of Jewish settlements there.[\[44\]](#cite_note-Reuters20250318a-45)
 Netanyahu has thus far resisted those calls, and when he signed the ceasefire agreement in January, the [Israeli Security Minister](/wiki/Ministry_of_National_Security_(Israel) "Ministry of National Security (Israel)")
 [Itamar Ben-Gvir](/wiki/Itamar_Ben-Gvir "Itamar Ben-Gvir")
 left Netanyahu's coalition.[\[44\]](#cite_note-Reuters20250318a-45)
 After Israel attacked Gaza on 18 March, Ben-Gvir rejoined the coalition.[\[28\]](#cite_note-PBS20250318-28)
 Opposition members accused Netanyahu and [his government](/wiki/Thirty-seventh_government_of_Israel "Thirty-seventh government of Israel")
 of failing to eliminate Hamas and allied groups' military capabilities or to rescue the remaining [Israeli hostages](/wiki/Gaza_war_hostage_crisis "Gaza war hostage crisis")
 in Gaza.[\[45\]](#cite_note-46)

Netanyahu's critics have said that the 18 March attacks are a result of Netanyahu's legal troubles.[\[14\]](#cite_note-BBC20250318-14)
 Netanyahu was scheduled on 18 March to testify in [his corruption trial](/wiki/Trial_of_Benjamin_Netanyahu "Trial of Benjamin Netanyahu")
, but as a result of the attacks, the legal proceedings were postponed.[\[46\]](#cite_note-47)

### Proposed expulsion of Palestinians from the Gaza Strip

See also: [Potential American ownership of the Gaza Strip](/wiki/Potential_American_ownership_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Potential American ownership of the Gaza Strip")
 and [Nakba](/wiki/Nakba "Nakba")

On 4 February 2025, Trump announced an intention to "take over" and "own" the Gaza Strip.[\[47\]](#cite_note-48)
 Trump proposed that Gaza's 2 million Palestinians be permanently relocated from the Strip.[\[48\]](#cite_note-Yahoo20250318-49)
 This plan was supported by Netanyahu but condemned by human rights experts as a violation of international law.[\[48\]](#cite_note-Yahoo20250318-49)
 The 18 March attacks were done with Trump's approval.[\[48\]](#cite_note-Yahoo20250318-49)

The Israeli [Nachala organization](/wiki/Nachala_(organisation) "Nachala (organisation)")
 had repeatedly called for Netanyahu to defeat Hamas and expel Palestinians from the Gaza Strip.[\[49\]](#cite_note-50)

Attacks
-------

### 18 March

The attacks began on 18 March 2025, at approximately 02:20 local time during the Islamic holy month of [Ramadan](/wiki/Ramadan "Ramadan")
.[\[50\]](#cite_note-51)
[\[51\]](#cite_note-52)
[\[52\]](#cite_note-53)
 Following a [ceasefire](/wiki/2025_Gaza_war_ceasefire "2025 Gaza war ceasefire")
 instituted around two months prior, the Israeli strikes of 18 March 2025 were a surprise attack,[\[8\]](#cite_note-surprise-8)
 with the Israeli military stating that their attack "plan was kept in closed circles in the IDF to create an element of surprise and deception."[\[53\]](#cite_note-54)

Israeli warplanes began entering Gaza at 02:30,[\[54\]](#cite_note-55)
 and the Israel Defense Forces announced on [Telegram](/wiki/Telegram_(software) "Telegram (software)")
 that it and the [Israeli Security Agency](/wiki/Israeli_Security_Agency "Israeli Security Agency")
 were "conducting extensive strikes on terror targets belonging to the Hamas terrorist organization in the Gaza Strip".[\[35\]](#cite_note-NYTimesInfo-35)
 According to the [Associated Press](/wiki/Associated_Press "Associated Press")
, Israeli prime minister [Benjamin Netanyahu](/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu "Benjamin Netanyahu")
 ordered the strikes after ceasefire talks appeared to stall.[\[55\]](#cite_note-56)
 The strikes have targeted [Rafah](/wiki/Rafah "Rafah")
, [Khan Yunis](/wiki/Khan_Yunis "Khan Yunis")
, [Deir al-Balah](/wiki/Deir_al-Balah "Deir al-Balah")
, [Nuseirat](/wiki/Nuseirat_refugee_camp "Nuseirat refugee camp")
, [Bureij](/wiki/Bureij "Bureij")
, Al-Zaytoun, Al-Karama, and [Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Beit_Hanoun "Beit Hanoun")
, according to the IDF.[\[56\]](#cite_note-57)
 [Al Jazeera](/wiki/Al_Jazeera "Al Jazeera")
 reported strikes in [Al-Mawasi, Rafah](/wiki/Al-Mawasi,_Rafah "Al-Mawasi, Rafah")
.[\[57\]](#cite_note-58)

An unidentified Israeli military official stated to [Reuters](/wiki/Reuters "Reuters")
 that they would continue the attacks indefinitely, and would incorporate further military elements beyond airstrikes.[\[58\]](#cite_note-AlJazeeraLive20250318-59)

An [Al Jazeera](/wiki/Al_Jazeera_Media_Network "Al Jazeera Media Network")
 reporter in Gaza stated that heavy shelling from [Israeli tanks](/wiki/Tanks_of_the_Israel_Defense_Forces "Tanks of the Israel Defense Forces")
 targeted eastern sections of [Abasan](/wiki/Abasan_al-Kabira "Abasan al-Kabira")
, Khan Yunis. [Jump to content](#bodyContent)

| Location | [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip "Gaza Strip") |
| Planned¬†by | ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/40px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png)[Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel") |
| Target | [Issam al-Da'alis](/wiki/Issam_al-Da%27alis "Issam al-Da'alis")<br> and other [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")<br> leaders (per Israel)[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)<br>  <br>[Indiscriminate bombing](/wiki/Indiscriminate_bombing "Indiscriminate bombing")<br> of the Gaza Strip (per [B'Tselem](/wiki/B%27Tselem "B'Tselem")<br>, Aljazeera, Colombia)[\[2\]](#cite_note-btselem-2)<br>[\[3\]](#cite_note-AlJazeera20250318-3)<br>[\[4\]](#cite_note-prensalatina-4) |
| Date | 18¬†March 2025; 5 months ago¬†(2025-03-18)  <br>2:30 a.m. The forum demanded a return to ceasefire conditions and urged United States President Donald Trump to negotiate for the release of all hostages.[\[88\]](#cite_note-TimesOfIsraelLive20250318a-89)
    
*   [Human Rights Watch](/wiki/Human_Rights_Watch "Human Rights Watch")
     ‚Äî The director of the Israel-Palestine branch of the HRW [Omar Shakir](/w/index.php?title=Omar_Shakir_(director)&action=edit&redlink=1 "Omar Shakir (director) (page does not exist)")
    ¬†\[[d](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityPage/Q77261127#sitelinks-wikipedia "d:Special:EntityPage/Q77261127")\
    \], says that Israel is openly violating international law in Gaza and urges the international community to hold Israeli officials accountable and end all arms transfers to the country.[\[111\]](#cite_note-112)
    
*   ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Emblem_of_the_ICRC.svg/20px-Emblem_of_the_ICRC.svg.png) [International Committee of the Red Cross](/wiki/International_Committee_of_the_Red_Cross "International Committee of the Red Cross")
     ‚Äî The organization warns that medics are struggling to manage a sharp increase in casualties during the attacks and the blockade of humanitarian aid to Gaza.[\[112\]](#cite_note-113)
    
*   [Islamic Relief](/wiki/Islamic_Relief "Islamic Relief")
     ‚Äî The organization has condemned the inaction of [Western](/wiki/Western_world "Western world")
     and [Arab](/wiki/Arab_world "Arab world")
     Israeli allies, stating that their "superficial expressions of concerns" instead of imposing arms and trade restrictions against Israel meant little in the face of repeated violations of international law, and made them [complicit](/wiki/Complicity "Complicity")
     in the ongoing [crimes against humanity](/wiki/Crimes_against_humanity "Crimes against humanity")
    .[\[58\]](#cite_note-AlJazeeraLive20250318-59)
    
*   [M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res](/wiki/M%C3%A9decins_Sans_Fronti%C3%A8res "M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res")
     ‚Äî The organization calls for the resumption of the ceasefire and says that Israel is subjecting Gaza to [collective punishment](/wiki/Collective_punishment "Collective punishment")
    .[\[113\]](#cite_note-114)
    
*   ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/Norwegian_Refugee_council_english_logo.svg/40px-Norwegian_Refugee_council_english_logo.svg.png) [Norwegian Refugee Council](/wiki/Norwegian_Refugee_Council "Norwegian Refugee Council")
     ‚Äî the group's stated that the Israeli attacks threatens to "plunge Gaza into yet another cycle of mass death, destruction, and displacement".[\[114\]](#cite_note-115)
    
*   ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Save_the_Children_Logo.svg/40px-Save_the_Children_Logo.svg.png) [Save the Children](/wiki/Save_the_Children "Save the Children")
     ‚Äî humanitarian director based in central Gaza's [Deir al-Balah](/wiki/Deir_al-Balah "Deir al-Balah")
    , [Rachael Cummings](/w/index.php?title=Rachael_Cummings&action=edit&redlink=1 "Rachael Cummings (page does not exist)")
    ¬†\[[d](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityPage/Q96190234#sitelinks-wikipedia "d:Special:EntityPage/Q96190234")\
    \], said the collapse of the ceasefire was "nothing short of a death sentence for Gaza's children", she further stated that the denial of aid coinciding with the [holy month of Ramadan](/wiki/Ramadan "Ramadan")
     amounted to a "grave violation against children".[\[3\]](#cite_note-AlJazeera20250318-3)
    
*    ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Flag_of_the_United_Nations.svg/40px-Flag_of_the_United_Nations.svg.png)[United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations")
     ‚Äî [Secretary-General](/wiki/Secretary-General_of_the_United_Nations "Secretary-General of the United Nations")
     [Antonio Guterres](/wiki/Ant%C3%B3nio_Guterres "Ant√≥nio Guterres")
     said in a statement issued by his spokesperson that he is "shocked" by the Israeli attacks, which has killed "a meaningful number" of civilians, further stating that he "strongly appeals for the ceasefire to be respected, for unimpeded humanitarian assistance to be reestablished and for the remaining hostages to be released unconditionally".[\[3\]](#cite_note-AlJazeera20250318-3)
    *   ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/United_Nations_Relief_and_Works_Agency_for_Palestine_Refugees_in_the_Near_East_Logo.svg/20px-United_Nations_Relief_and_Works_Agency_for_Palestine_Refugees_in_the_Near_East_Logo.svg.png) [UNRWA](/wiki/UNRWA "UNRWA")
         ‚Äî The head of the organization [Philippe Lazzarini](/wiki/Philippe_Lazzarini "Philippe Lazzarini")

In the early hours of 18 March 2025, [Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 launched a [surprise attack](/wiki/Military_deception "Military deception")
[\[8\]](#cite_note-surprise-8)
 on the [Gaza Strip](/wiki/Gaza_Strip "Gaza Strip")
, effectively ending the [2025 Gaza war ceasefire](/wiki/2025_Gaza_war_ceasefire "2025 Gaza war ceasefire")
. After the first phase ended on 1 March, [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
 intended to move to the second phase of negotiations ‚Äì as envisioned in the original ceasefire deal ‚Äì while [Netanyahu](/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu "Benjamin Netanyahu")
 and the [Trump administration](/wiki/Second_presidency_of_Donald_Trump "Second presidency of Donald Trump")
 insisted on renegotiating the overall terms.[\[14\]](#cite_note-BBC20250318-14)
 Israel also refused to withdraw from sites in the Gaza Strip, despite the fact that it had agreed to do so in the ceasefire agreement.[\[14\]](#cite_note-BBC20250318-14)
 Further, during the ceasefire, Israel killed more than 140 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip.[\[14\]](#cite_note-BBC20250318-14)
 In March, Israel prevented all food and medicine from entering Gaza;[\[15\]](#cite_note-Time20250318-15)
 later it shut off electricity to the Gaza Strip's main desalination plant, effectively cutting off water.[\[16\]](#cite_note-Mahase2025-16)
 These actions have been deemed war crimes by aid organizations and human rights organizations, including M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res and Amnesty International.[\[16\]](#cite_note-Mahase2025-16)
[\[17\]](#cite_note-Amnesty20250310-17)
[\[18\]](#cite_note-JordanTimes20250310-18)

The Israeli military's renewed offensive affected large parts of the Gaza Strip, including [Gaza City](/wiki/Gaza_City "Gaza City")
, [Khan Yunis](/wiki/Khan_Yunis "Khan Yunis")
, and [Rafah](/wiki/Rafah "Rafah")
,[\[19\]](#cite_note-Telegraph20250318-19)
 and killed more than 591 people, mostly women and children.[\[20\]](#cite_note-AlJazeeraLive20250320-20)
[\[21\]](#cite_note-xinhua-21)
[\[19\]](#cite_note-Telegraph20250318-19)
[\[22\]](#cite_note-22)
 The airstrikes struck homes and set at least one tent camp on fire.[\[15\]](#cite_note-Time20250318-15)
 Hospitals were overwhelmed by dead and wounded.[\[15\]](#cite_note-Time20250318-15)
 Israel's government stated that the strikes targeted leadership figures, mid-ranking military commanders, and the operational infrastructure of Hamas.[\[19\]](#cite_note-Telegraph20250318-19)
 This has been disputed by experts such as Miranda Cleland of [Defence for Children International](/wiki/Defence_for_Children_International "Defence for Children International")
[\[23\]](#cite_note-23)
 and Spanish foreign minister [Jos√© Manuel Albares](/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Manuel_Albares "Jos√© Manuel Albares")
, who believe Israel "indiscriminately attacked" the Gaza Strip.[\[2\]](#cite_note-btselem-2)
[\[3\]](#cite_note-AlJazeera20250318-3)
[\[4\]](#cite_note-prensalatina-4)
[\[24\]](#cite_note-24)
 Several Palestinian families were killed _en masse_ as a result of the attacks.[\[25\]](#cite_note-25)

Hamas condemned the strikes as a violation of the ceasefire, accusing Israel of endangering the remaining Israeli hostages.[\[19\]](#cite_note-Telegraph20250318-19)
 It began responding militarily to the Israeli strikes on 20 March, when it fired rockets at [Tel Aviv](/wiki/Tel_Aviv "Tel Aviv")
.[\[26\]](#cite_note-NYTimes20250320-26)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-NYTimes20250318-5)
 The Israeli government said it carried out the attack in response to Hamas' refusal to extend a ceasefire through additional hostage releases. Hamas has denied this allegation.[\[29\]](#cite_note-reuters52025-29)

On 2 March, shortly after the beginning of [Ramadan](/wiki/Ramadan "Ramadan")
, the Islamic month of fasting, Israel shut down the entry of all humanitarian aid (including food and fuel) into the Gaza Strip."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, which began on March 18, 2025, ending the ceasefire. The attacks targeted various locations in Gaza, including Deir al-Balah, and resulted in over 591 deaths, mostly women and children. The attacks were condemned by Hamas and international organizations. The article also mentions the context of the attacks, including the political climate and the involvement of the Trump administration. The attacks were a surprise and included airstrikes and artillery barrages. <image:39>

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

From 21 Jul 2025

_Peter Beaumont is a senior international reporter who has reported extensively from conflict zones including Africa, the Balkans, the Middle East and Ukraine_

Israel has launched substantial air raids and a ground operation in Gaza, targeting Deir al-Balah, the key hub for humanitarian efforts in the devastated Palestinian territory amid mounting warnings of widening starvation in the coastal strip.

The latest assault comes a day after the highest death toll in 21 months inflicted by the Israeli military on desperate Palestinians seeking food aid, with at least 85 killed on Sunday in what has become a grim and almost daily slaughter.

The UN food agency, the World Food Programme, said the majority of those killed on Sunday had gathered near the border fence with Israel in the hope of getting flour from a UN aid convoy when they were fired on by Israeli tanks and snipers.

Witnesses described massive airstrikes overnight in Deir al-Balah ‚Äì the last remaining area of [Gaza](https://www.theguardian.com/world/gaza)
 that has not suffered significant war damage. At least 20 of the remaining 50 hostages in captivity in Gaza are believed to be still alive.

Israel launched its renewed assault despite reports in the Hebrew media that Israeli officials believed Hamas was close to agreeing to a ceasefire.

The latest Israeli assault followed forced evacuation orders for between 50‚Äì80,000 people in Deir al-Balah, in the centre of the [Gaza](https://www.theguardian.com/world/gaza)
 Strip, leaving almost 87% of the territory under such orders.

‚ÄúWith this latest order, the area of Gaza under displacement orders or within Israeli-militarised zones has risen to 87.8%, leaving 2.1 million civilians squeezed into a fragmented 12% of the strip, where essential services have collapsed,‚Äù the UN said in a statement released by its Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affair.

[Israel launches air and ground offensive on Deir al-Balah in central Gaza\
\
Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/jul/21/israel-launches-air-ground-offensive-deir-al-balah-central-gaza)

*   **Israeli tanks pushed into southern and eastern areas of the Gazan city of Deir al-Balah for the first time on Monday, an area where Israeli sources said the military believes some of the remaining hostages may be being held by Hamas.** Gaza medics said at least three Palestinians were killed and several were wounded in tank shelling that hit eight houses and three mosques in the area, and which came a day after the military ordered residents to leave, saying it planned to fight Hamas militants.
    
*   **Pope Leo has warned against the ‚Äúindiscriminate use of force‚Äù and the ‚Äúforced mass displacement‚Äù of people in the Gaza strip in a phone conversation with the Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas on Monday, the Vatican said in a statement.** It was the first official conversation between the two men since Leo‚Äôs papacy began.
    
*   **Gaza‚Äôs health ministry has said the Palestinian death toll has surpassed 59,000 after more than 21 months of war.** In an update from the Associated Press, the ministry says 59,029 people have been killed since the war started on 7 October 2023, while another 142,135 have been wounded.
    
*   **Medical Aid for Palestinians (MAP) said on Sunday that evacuations orders from Israel have directly endangered ‚Äúvital humanitarian and primary healthcare sites‚Äù.** The charity said in a statement that the move was ‚Äúaccelerating the systematic dismantling of **Gaza‚Äôs** already-decimated healthcare system‚Äù.
    
*   **Israel on Monday rejected the joint statement published by over 20 countries calling for an end to the war in Gaza, ‚Äúas it is disconnected from reality and sends the wrong message to Hamas‚Äù, the foreign ministry said.** Britain and more than 20 other countries called on Monday for an immediate end to the war in [Gaza](https://www.theguardian.com/world/gaza)
     and criticised the Israeli government‚Äôs aid delivery model after hundreds of Palestinians were killed near sites distributing food.
    
*   **An Israeli undercover force detained Marwan Al-Hams, a senior Gaza Health Ministry official, outside the field hospital of the International Committee of the Red Cross in the southern Gaza Strip on Monday, the health ministry said according to a report from the Reuters news agency.** Hams, in charge of field hospitals in the enclave, was on his way to visit the ICRC field hospital in northern Rafah when an Israeli force ‚Äúabducted‚Äù him after opening fire, killing one person and wounding another civilian nearby, according to the ministry.
    
*   **Gaza health officials said on Monday at least 13 people, including two women and five children, were killed in Israeli strikes since the previous night.** The Israeli military had no immediate comment on the strikes. Our teams and partners continue to face major barriers to communication, particularly with those still near Camp 3.
> 
> Together with our local partners, we have arranged for guards to protect all three camps from theft and looting.

*   **Washington cannot ‚Äúcompel‚Äù [Israel](https://www.theguardian.com/world/israel)
     to do anything, US special envoy Thomas Barrack said in Beirut on Monday, in response to a reporter‚Äôs question about Lebanese demands that the US guarantees a halt to Israeli strikes on Lebanese territory.** The US last month proposed a roadmap to Lebanon‚Äôs top officials to fully disarm Hezbollah within four months, in exchange for a halt to Israeli strikes and a withdrawal of Israeli troops still occupying positions in southern Lebanon.
    
*   **The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights monitor said on Monday that the ceasefire in the southern province of Sweida was holding, despite isolated gunfire in areas north of Sweida city with no reports of casualties.** The agreement announced on Saturday put an end to the sectarian violence that has left more than 1,100 dead, most of them Druze fighters and civilians, according to the monitor.
    
*   **The Syrian government on Monday started evacuating Bedouin families trapped inside the city of Sweida, where Druze militiamen and Bedouin fighters have clashed for over a week.** The UN International Organization for Migration said about 128,571 people were displaced in the hostilities that started with a series of tit-for-tat kidnappings and attacks a week ago.
    
*   **A US envoy doubled down on Washington‚Äôs support for the new government in Syria, saying on Monday there is ‚Äúno Plan B‚Äù to working with the current authorities to unite the country still reeling from a nearly 14-year civil war and now wrecked by a new outbreak of sectarian violence.** Tom Barrack, who is ambassador to Turkey and special envoy to Syria and also has a short-term mandate in Lebanon, took a critical tone toward Israel‚Äôs recent intervention in Syria, calling it poorly timed and saying that it complicated efforts to stabilise the region.

     staff, as the Palestinian territory experiences surging levels of hunger, Agence France-Presse (AFP) reports.** Gaza‚Äôs population of more than 2 million people are facing severe shortages of food and other essentials, with doctors, the civil defence agency and medical charity **Doctors Without Borders (MSF)** reporting a spike in malnutrition cases in recent days.
    
*   **A trilateral meeting between Iran, Russia and China will take place on Tuesday regarding Tehran‚Äôs nuclear programme and the UN snapback mechanism, Iranian foreign ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said on Monday.** The UN snapback mechanism refers to efforts to reimpose international sanctions on Iran.
    
*   **Tehran on Monday accused the UK, France and Germany of failing to respect the 2015 Iran nuclear deal, after they threatened to reimpose sanctions over its atomic programme.** The 2015 deal, reached between Iran and the UN security council‚Äôs permanent members ‚Äì Britain, China, France, Russia and the US ‚Äì plus Germany imposed curbs on Iran‚Äôs nuclear programme in exchange for sanctions relief.
    

**The charity Action For Humanity has confirmed that, following the latest evacuation orders in Deir al-Balah, three of its displacement camps have been directly affected by the intensifying military operations and worsening security situation.**

In a statement, a spokesperson said:

> Camp 5 has now been fully evacuated, with only the landowner remaining to safeguard essential humanitarian assets. We condemn the drip feeding of aid and the inhumane killing of civilians, including children, seeking to meet their most basic needs of water and food._

The countries called on the **Israeli government** to immediately lift restrictions on the flow of aid and ‚Äúurgently enable the UN and humanitarian NGOs to do their life saving work safely and effectively‚Äù.

They added:

> _We are prepared to take further action to support an immediate ceasefire and a political pathway to security and peace for Israelis, Palestinians and the entire region._

The statement was signed by the EU Commissioner for Equality, Preparedness and Crisis Management, as well as the foreign ministers of Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and the UK.

_Johana Bhuiyan is a senior tech reporter and editor for Guardian US, based in San Francisco._

Meta is hosting ads on Facebook, Instagram and Threads from pro-Israel entities that are raising money for military equipment including drones and tactical gear for Israeli Defense Force battalions, seemingly a violation of the company‚Äôs stated advertising policies, new research shows.

‚ÄúWe are the sniper team of Unit Shaked, stationed in [Gaza](https://www.theguardian.com/world/gaza)
, and we urgently need shooting tripods to complete our mission in Jabalia,‚Äù one ad on Facebook read, first published on 11 June and still active on 17 July.

These paid ads were first discovered and flagged to [Meta](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/meta)
 by global consumer watchdog, Ek≈ç, which identified at least 117 ads published since March 2025 that explicitly sought donations for military equipment for the IDF. Earlier today, we were informed that the women and children have since been relocated to safer areas within Deir al-Balah.
>

**Russian defence minister Andrei Belousov and his Iranian counterpart Aziz Nasirzadeh discussed strengthening military cooperation at a meeting in Moscow, Russian state news agency RIA reported on Monday, citing the Iranian ambassador.**

The meeting followed talks on Sunday between Russian president Vladimir Putin and Ali Larijani, a senior adviser to Iran‚Äôs supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, on the situation in the Middle East and issues surrounding Iran‚Äôs nuclear programme.

Russia has a strategic partnership treaty with Iran, and condemned the Israeli and US bombing of Iranian nuclear sites in June.

**Washington cannot ‚Äúcompel‚Äù [Israel](https://www.theguardian.com/world/israel)
 to do anything, US special envoy Thomas Barrack said in Beirut on Monday, in response to a reporter‚Äôs question about Lebanese demands that the US guarantees a halt to Israeli strikes on Lebanese territory.**

The US last month proposed a roadmap to Lebanon‚Äôs top officials to fully disarm Hezbollah within four months, in exchange for a halt to Israeli strikes and a withdrawal of Israeli troops still occupying positions in southern Lebanon.

Lebanon has asked Washington to act as a security guarantor to ensure that Israel will pull out its troops in full and halt targeting operations against members of Hezbollah, if the armed group begins handing in weapons.

Asked about those guarantees, Barrack told reporters after a meeting with Lebanese prime minister Nawaf Salam that the US ‚Äúhas no business in trying to compel Israel to do anything.‚Äù

He also told reporters that the US was not forcing Lebanon to strip Hezbollah of its arms, or considering sanctions against Lebanese officials if Hezbollah is not disarmed.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no consequence, there‚Äôs no threat, there‚Äôs no whip,‚Äù Barrack said.

**Belgian authorities** said on Monday that they had briefly held and questioned **two Israeli citizens** who attended an electronic music festival, after **pro-Palestinian groups accused them of war crimes,** Agence France-Presse (AFP) reports.

Prosecutors said they received legal complaints alleging that two Israeli soldiers responsible for ‚Äúserious violations of international humanitarian law‚Äù in **Gaza** were spotted at the **Tomorrowland festival** near the northern city of **Antwerp** last week.

The federal prosecutor‚Äôs office said it had ‚Äúasked the police to locate the two people named in the complaint and to interview them‚Äù.

‚ÄúFollowing these interviews, they were released,‚Äù it said in a statement.

The office said that it took action after concluding that Belgian courts have extraterritorial jurisdiction over alleged war crimes.

‚ÄúNo further information will be given at this stage of the investigation,‚Äù the office said.

The pair have not been named.

Last week, the **Hind Rajab Foundation (HRF),** a Belgian pro-Palestinian organisation, said it had identified two Israeli soldiers ‚Äúresponsible for grave international crimes‚Äù in Gaza among the crowds at Tomorrowland.

It claimed that a group of young Israeli men was seen at the festival waving a flag of the **Givati Brigade,** an Israeli military unit involved in the fighting in the Palestinian territory.

HRF said it then filed a complaint with prosecutors in association with the **Global Legal Action Network,** a lawyers group specialising in human rights violations.

**The UN agency for Palestinian refugees said on Monday that it was ‚Äúreceiving desperate messages of starvation‚Äù from its [Gaza](https://www.theguardian.com/world/gaza)
 staff, as the Palestinian territory experiences surging levels of hunger, Agence France-Presse (AFP) reports.**

Gaza‚Äôs population of more than 2 million people are facing severe shortages of food and other essentials, with doctors, the civil defence agency and medical charity **Doctors Without Borders (MSF)** reporting a spike in malnutrition cases in recent days.

**In a post on X, Unrwa said that shortages in the Palestinian territory had caused food prices to increase by 40 times,** while the aid stockpiled in its warehouses outside Gaza could feed ‚Äúthe entire population for over three months.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe suffering in Gaza is manmade and must be stopped,‚Äù it wrote."

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

UN staff member killed in central Gaza blast, five others injured
=================================================================

19 March 2025 [Peace and Security](/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

At least one UN staffer has been killed and at least five others injured ‚Äì several very severely ‚Äì following an explosion at two UN guesthouses in Deir al Balah in the central Gaza Strip on Wednesday.

The UN is verifying and confirming the details, including the circumstances that led up to the incident at the compound,, but **it was not due to ‚Äúany action‚Äù that was being taken by UN personnel to remove ‚Äúunexploded ordinance‚Äù**, the head of the [UN Office for Project Services](https://www.unops.org/)
 (UNOPS) [said](https://www.unops.org/news-and-stories/speeches/statement-on-unops-colleague-killed-at-unops-premises-in-gaza)
 during a press conference in Brussels.

Tweet URL

> [](https://twitter.com/UNOPS/statuses/1902381889425441125)

According to media reports, the Israeli military ‚Äì which has resumed deadly strikes in the Gaza Strip, killing hundreds since Monday ‚Äì has denied attacking the compound.

‚Äú**These premises were well known by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) and they were ‚Äòdeconflicted‚Äô**,‚Äù said, UNOPS chief Jorge Moreira da Silva, explaining that ‚Äú**everyone knew who was working inside the premises ‚Äì it was UN personnel, UNOPS personnel**.‚Äù

No accident
-----------

‚ÄúThis was not an accident, this was an incident,‚Äù he told journalists, adding that additional information is being collected.

‚Äú**What we do know is that an explosive ordnance was dropped or fired at the infrastructure and detonated inside the building**,‚Äù he said, adding it was unclear if it had been due to air-drop weapons, artillery or rocket fire.

Mr. da Silva said.

The UN buildings are situated in an ‚Äúisolated area‚Äù in Dier al Balah.

![UNOPS Executive Director Jorge Moreira da Silva (right) speaking to the press in the Belgian capital, Brussels.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/19-03-2025-UNOPS-Jorge-da-Silva.jpg/image1170x530cropped.jpg "UNOPS Executive Director Jorge Moreira da Silva (right) speaking to the press in the Belgian capital, Brussels.")

UN Brussels/Jorge Varas Mardones

UNOPS Executive Director Jorge Moreira da Silva (right) speaking to the press in the Belgian capital, Brussels.

Evacuating the injured
----------------------

As investigations continue into the incident, the ‚Äútop priority‚Äù is the evacuation of injured staff members, Mr. Their efforts include delivering essential supplies such as fuel and assisting in demining and explosive removal.

Additionally, the agency manages the so-called UN 2720 Mechanism for Gaza, which was [mandated](https://docs.un.org/en/s/res/2720(2023))
 by the [Security Council](https://main.un.org/securitycouncil/)
 to accelerate humanitarian aid into the enclave.

UN chief condemns attacks
-------------------------

Tweet URL

> [](https://twitter.com/UN_News_Centre/statuses/1902461210311930291)

[Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres](https://www.un.org/sg/)
 reaffirmed that all parties to the conflict have a legal obligation to protect UN premises, which must remain absolutely inviolable.

In a [statement](https://www.un.org/sg/en/content/sg/statement/2025-03-19/statement-attributable-the-spokesperson-for-the-secretary-general-%E2%80%93-gaza)
 issued by his spokesperson, the UN chief strongly condemned the attacks and called for a full investigation.

‚Äú**Today‚Äôs deadly strike brings the number of UN colleagues killed in Gaza since 7 October 2023 to at least 280**,‚Äù the statement noted.

Mr. The hostages must be released immediately and unconditionally,‚Äù said the statement.

*   [Gaza](/en/tags/gaza)
    

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/03/1161261 "Share this via Facebook")
 [Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=UN staff member killed in central Gaza blast, five others injured&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/03/1161261 "Share this via Twitter")
 Print [Email](mailto:?subject=UN staff member killed in central Gaza blast, five others injured&body=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/03/1161261 "Share this via Email") da Silva said.

‚ÄúWe have stayed and delivered for the people in Gaza in the last year and a half. This was not the first time a first colleague from UNOPS lost their life,‚Äù he added, noting that a staffer who drove aid trucks was killed around a year ago in the line of duty.

‚Äú**It is very difficult to operate in Gaza‚Ä¶we have been challenged by the fact that international humanitarian law has not been respected**,‚Äù he said.

UNOPS teams in Gaza have been carrying out critical humanitarian work, supporting hundreds of thousands of civilians severely affected by the conflict. da Silva stressed that attacks against humanitarian premises are a breach of international law. ¬†

‚ÄúUN personnel and its premises must be protected by all sides. **The civilian population relies on the UN for lifesaving assistance, they are an essential lifeline at the time of utter tragedy and devastation**,‚Äù he said.

Previous attacks
----------------

The incident took place at around 11:30 AM local time on Wednesday. Guterres emphasised that all military operations must respect and prioritise civilian protection.

‚Äú**The Secretary-General stresses the need for the ceasefire to be respected to bring an end to the suffering of the people**."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The UN News article, published on March 19, 2025, reports that an explosion at two UN guesthouses in Deir al Balah, central Gaza Strip, killed at least one UN staff member and injured at least five others. <image:1>. The article states that the Israeli military denied attacking the compound, which was known to them and "deconflicted". The article also mentions that the UN Secretary-General condemned the attacks and called for a full investigation.

image_search("bombing Deir al-Balah Gaza")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/March_2025_Israeli_attacks_on_the_Gaza_Strip): 
Content: The Wikipedia article discusses the March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, which began on March 18, 2025, ending the ceasefire. The attacks targeted various locations in Gaza, including Deir al-Balah, and resulted in over 591 deaths, mostly women and children. The attacks were condemned by Hamas and international organizations. The article also mentions the context of the attacks, including the political climate and the involvement of the Trump administration. The attacks were a surprise and included airstrikes and artillery barrages. <image:39>


From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2025/jul/21/gaza-israel-war-latest-situation-updates-live-news): 
Content: The Guardian published an article on July 21, 2025, discussing the ongoing conflict in Gaza. The article reports on an Israeli air and ground assault on Deir al-Balah, with the military believing Hamas is holding hostages there. The article mentions that at least eight people were reported dead as Israeli tanks entered Deir al-Balah. The article also mentions that the Palestinian death toll has surpassed 59,000 since October 7, 2023. The article includes an image of smoke rising during Israeli strikes in Deir Al-Balah on July 21, 2025. <image:4396>


From [Source](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/03/1161261): 
Content: The UN News article, published on March 19, 2025, reports that an explosion at two UN guesthouses in Deir al Balah, central Gaza Strip, killed at least one UN staff member and injured at least five others. <image:1>. The article states that the Israeli military denied attacking the compound, which was known to them and "deconflicted". The article also mentions that the UN Secretary-General condemned the attacks and called for a full investigation.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The web sources discuss the March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, including Deir al-Balah, which resulted in over 591 deaths. The attacks began on March 18, 2025, ending the ceasefire. The Guardian reported on an Israeli air and ground assault on Deir al-Balah in July 2025, with at least eight people reported dead. The UN News reported an explosion at two UN guesthouses in Deir al Balah in March 2025, which killed at least one UN staff member.

The Wikipedia article mentions the attacks included airstrikes and artillery barrages. The Guardian article includes an image of smoke rising during Israeli strikes in Deir Al-Balah on July 21, 2025. The UN News article includes an image of soldiers. The Wikipedia article also includes the image <image:39>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:39>

## Elaboration
The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. More information is needed to determine the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it.


## Actions
```
web_search("Deir al-Balah Gaza bombing March 2025")
image_search("bombing Deir al-Balah Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources discuss the March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, including Deir al-Balah, which resulted in over 591 deaths. The attacks began on March 18, 2025, ending the ceasefire. The Guardian reported on an Israeli air and ground assault on Deir al-Balah in July 2025, with at least eight people reported dead. The UN News reported an explosion at two UN guesthouses in Deir al Balah in March 2025, which killed at least one UN staff member.

The Wikipedia article mentions the attacks included airstrikes and artillery barrages. The Guardian article includes an image of smoke rising during Israeli strikes in Deir Al-Balah on July 21, 2025. The UN News article includes an image of soldiers. The Wikipedia article also includes the image <image:39>

### Evidence from `image_search`
Al Jazeera published an article about Israeli strikes on Deir al-Balah in central Gaza, including an image of the destruction (<image:4404>

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that Deir al-Balah in the Gaza Strip was heavily bombarded by Israel in March 2025. The Wikipedia article includes the image in the claim. The web search results mention that the attacks resulted in casualties. The claim is therefore likely true.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:39>

## Elaboration
The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. More information is needed to determine the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it.


## Actions
```
web_search("Deir al-Balah Gaza bombing March 2025")
image_search("bombing Deir al-Balah Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources discuss the March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, including Deir al-Balah, which resulted in over 591 deaths. The attacks began on March 18, 2025, ending the ceasefire. The Guardian reported on an Israeli air and ground assault on Deir al-Balah in July 2025, with at least eight people reported dead. The UN News reported an explosion at two UN guesthouses in Deir al Balah in March 2025, which killed at least one UN staff member.

The Wikipedia article mentions the attacks included airstrikes and artillery barrages. The Guardian article includes an image of smoke rising during Israeli strikes in Deir Al-Balah on July 21, 2025. The UN News article includes an image of soldiers. The Wikipedia article also includes the image <image:39>

### Evidence from `image_search`

## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Deir al-Balah in the Gaza Strip was heavily bombarded by Israel in March 2025. The Wikipedia article includes the image in the claim. The web search results mention that the attacks resulted in casualties. The claim is therefore likely true.

The image in the claim is present in the Wikipedia article about the attacks on Deir al-Balah in March 2025. The web search confirms that Deir al-Balah was heavily bombarded by Israel in March 2025, resulting in casualties. Therefore, the claim is factually accurate.

`true`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:39>

## Elaboration
The reverse image search did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. More information is needed to determine the image's origin, the event it depicts, and the details surrounding it.


## Actions
```
web_search("Deir al-Balah Gaza bombing March 2025")
image_search("bombing Deir al-Balah Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources discuss the March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, including Deir al-Balah, which resulted in over 591 deaths. The attacks began on March 18, 2025, ending the ceasefire. The Guardian reported on an Israeli air and ground assault on Deir al-Balah in July 2025, with at least eight people reported dead. The UN News reported an explosion at two UN guesthouses in Deir al Balah in March 2025, which killed at least one UN staff member.

The Wikipedia article mentions the attacks included airstrikes and artillery barrages. The Guardian article includes an image of smoke rising during Israeli strikes in Deir Al-Balah on July 21, 2025. The UN News article includes an image of soldiers. The Wikipedia article also includes the image <image:39>

### Evidence from `image_search`
Al Jazeera published an article about Israeli strikes on Deir al-Balah in central Gaza, including an image of the destruction (<image:4404>

## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Deir al-Balah in the Gaza Strip was heavily bombarded by Israel in March 2025. The Wikipedia article includes the image in the claim. The web search results mention that the attacks resulted in casualties. The claim is therefore likely true.


## Final Judgement
The image in the claim is present in the Wikipedia article about the attacks on Deir al-Balah in March 2025. The web search confirms that Deir al-Balah was heavily bombarded by Israel in March 2025, resulting in casualties. Therefore, the claim is factually accurate.

`true`

## Summary

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand‚Äôs new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:41> This image shows Israel bombing the surroundings of Southern Damascus in February 2025, destroying its last remaining army depots."

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:41>)

ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿπŸàŸäÿØ

##### ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿπŸàŸäÿØ ÿßÿ®ŸÜ ŸÖÿ≠ÿßŸÅÿ∏ÿ© ÿØÿ±ÿπÿßÿå Ÿäÿ™ÿ≠ÿØÿ´ ŸÑÿØÿ±ÿπÿß 24 ÿπŸÜ ÿ™ÿ≠ÿØŸäÿßÿ™ Ÿàÿ¢ŸÅÿßŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿä: ŸÜÿ≠Ÿà ÿ®ŸÜÿßÿ° ÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ ÿ≠ÿ± ŸàŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇŸÑ ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ŸÖÿß ÿ®ÿπÿØ ÿßŸÑŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÖ

**Ÿäÿ¥ŸáÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿä ÿßŸÑŸäŸàŸÖ ŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ŸÖŸÅÿµŸÑŸäÿ© ÿ®ÿπÿØ ÿ≥ŸÇŸàÿ∑ ÿßŸÑŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä ÿ£ÿ≠ŸÉŸÖ ŸÇÿ®ÿ∂ÿ™Ÿá ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ÿßŸÅÿ© ŸàŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿßÿ™Ÿáÿß ŸÑÿπŸÇŸàÿØ ÿ∑ŸàŸäŸÑÿ©**ÿå ŸàŸÑÿß ÿ≥ŸäŸÖÿß ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÜŸàÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ´ŸÑÿßÿ´ ÿπÿ¥ÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿÆŸäÿ±ÿ©. ŸàŸÖÿπ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ≠ŸàŸëŸÑÿå ÿßŸÜŸÅÿ™ÿ≠ ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿßÿ® ÿ£ŸÖÿßŸÖ ÿ£ŸÅŸÇŸç ÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØŸç Ÿäÿ∑ŸÖÿ≠ ÿ•ŸÑŸäŸá ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸäŸàŸÜ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸäÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿßÿå ŸÑÿ™ŸÖŸÉŸäŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿπŸÖŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸä ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ± ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇŸÑ. ŸàŸÖÿπ ÿ∞ŸÑŸÉÿå ŸÅÿ•ŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ∑ÿ±ŸäŸÇ ŸÜÿ≠Ÿà ÿ™ŸÜÿ∏ŸäŸÖ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ∑ÿßÿπ Ÿàÿ∂ŸÖÿßŸÜ ÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿπÿ®Ÿäÿ± ŸÑÿß Ÿäÿ≤ÿßŸÑ ŸÖŸÑŸäÿ¶ÿßŸã ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ≠ÿØŸäÿßÿ™.

ŸÅŸä Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸäÿßŸÇ **ÿ£ÿ¨ÿ±ÿ™ ÿ¥ÿ®ŸÉÿ© ÿØÿ±ÿπÿß 24 ŸÖŸÇÿßÿ®ŸÑÿ©Ÿã ÿÆÿßÿµŸëÿ© ŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸä [ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿπŸàŸäÿØ](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100002329474787)
 ŸÖŸÜ ÿ£ÿ®ŸÜÿßÿ° ŸÖÿ≠ÿßŸÅÿ∏ÿ© ÿØÿ±ÿπÿß**ÿå ŸÑŸÑÿ≠ÿØŸäÿ´ ÿπŸÜ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¥ŸáÿØ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÉÿ´Ÿäÿ± ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖŸàÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÇÿ© ÿ®Ÿá Ÿàÿ™ÿ≠ÿØŸäÿßÿ™ Ÿàÿ£ŸàŸÑŸàŸäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿπŸÖŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸä ŸÅŸä Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ©. Ÿäÿ™ŸÜÿßŸàŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ≠Ÿàÿßÿ± ŸÇÿ∂ÿßŸäÿß ŸÖÿ´ŸÑ ŸàÿßŸÇÿπ ÿßŸÑÿßÿ™ÿ≠ÿßÿØÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ£ŸèŸÜÿ¥ÿ¶ÿ™ ŸÖÿ§ÿÆÿ±Ÿãÿßÿå Ÿàÿ∏ÿ±ŸàŸÅ ÿßŸÑŸÜÿßÿ¥ÿ∑ŸäŸÜ ŸàÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸäŸäŸÜ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸÑÿßÿØÿå Ÿàÿ£ÿØÿßÿ° ÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸÉŸàŸÖÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿßŸÜÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸäÿå ŸàÿßŸÑÿØŸàÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä Ÿäÿ¨ÿ® ÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ÿ∂ÿ∑ŸÑÿπ ÿ®Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸäÿ© ŸÑÿØÿπŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ≠ŸàŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸä ŸÅŸä ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿß.

**ŸäŸÜÿ≠ÿØÿ± ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿπŸàŸäÿØÿå ŸÖŸÜ ÿ®ŸÑÿØÿ© ŸÖÿπÿ±ÿ®ÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ±ŸäŸÅ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ŸÇŸä ŸÖŸÜ ŸÖÿ≠ÿßŸÅÿ∏ÿ© ÿØÿ±ÿπÿß.** ŸàŸáŸà ÿÆÿ±Ÿäÿ¨ ÿ¨ÿßŸÖÿπÿ© ÿØŸÖÿ¥ŸÇ ŸÇÿ≥ŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ÿßŸÅÿ©. ÿπŸÖŸÑ ŸÖÿØŸäÿ±ÿßŸã ŸÑŸÅÿ±ÿπ ŸàŸÉÿßŸÑÿ© ÿ≥ÿßŸÜÿß ŸÅŸä ÿØÿ±ÿπÿßÿå ŸàŸÅŸä ÿµÿ≠ŸÅ ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿ© ÿ£ÿÆÿ±Ÿâ ŸÇÿ®ŸÑ ÿßŸÜÿØŸÑÿßÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ´Ÿàÿ±ÿ© ŸÅŸä 2011. ŸàÿπŸÖŸÑ ÿ®ÿπÿØŸáÿß ŸÅŸä ÿ™ŸÑŸÅÿ≤ŸäŸàŸÜ ‚Äúÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿß ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿπÿ®‚Äù ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä ÿ£ŸèŸÜÿ¥ÿ¶ ŸÅŸä ÿπŸÖŸëÿßŸÜ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ±ÿØŸÜÿå ÿ≠Ÿäÿ´ ŸÉÿßŸÜ ŸäŸÇŸäŸÖ ŸáŸÜÿßŸÉ. ÿ®ÿπÿØŸáÿß ŸÅŸä ÿ™ŸÑŸÅÿ≤ŸäŸàŸÜ ‚Äú18 ÿ¢ÿ∞ÿßÿ±‚Äù ŸÑŸÑŸÖÿπÿßÿ±ÿ∂ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿ©. ŸàŸÅŸä ÿπÿßŸÖ 2014ÿå Ÿáÿßÿ¨ÿ± ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ŸÅÿ±ŸÜÿ≥ÿß. ÿπŸÖŸÑ ŸÖŸÜ ŸáŸÜÿßŸÉ ŸÖÿπ ÿ™ŸÑŸÅÿ≤ŸäŸàŸÜ ‚Äúÿ£Ÿàÿ±ŸäŸÜÿ™‚Äù ŸÉŸÖÿ±ÿßÿ≥ŸÑÿå ŸàŸÉÿ∞ŸÑŸÉ ŸÅŸä ŸÖŸàŸÇÿπ ‚Äúÿ≤ŸÖÿßŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸàÿµŸÑ‚Äù. ŸÉŸÖÿß ÿ™ÿπÿßŸàŸÜ ŸÖÿπ ‚Äúÿ™ŸÑŸÅÿ≤ŸäŸàŸÜ ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿß‚Äù. Ÿàÿ≠ÿßŸÑŸäÿßŸãÿå ŸäŸÜÿ¥ÿ± ŸÖŸÇÿßŸÑÿßÿ™Ÿá ŸÅŸä ÿπÿØÿØ ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿßŸÇÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ•ŸÑŸÉÿ™ÿ±ŸàŸÜŸäÿ© ÿ®ÿµŸÅÿ© ŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇŸÑÿ©ÿå ŸàŸÑŸäÿ≥ÿ™ ÿØÿßÿ¶ŸÖÿ©.

ŸÉŸäŸÅ ÿ™ŸèŸÇŸäŸëŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¥ŸáÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸä ŸÅŸä ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿß ÿßŸÑŸäŸàŸÖ ÿ®ÿπÿØ ÿ≥ŸÇŸàÿ∑ ÿßŸÑŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä ŸÉÿßŸÜ ŸäŸèÿ≠ŸÉŸÖ ŸÇÿ®ÿ∂ÿ™Ÿá ÿ®ÿ¥ŸÉŸÑ ŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ± ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ≥ŸÖŸä ŸàŸÉŸÑ Ÿàÿ≥ÿßÿ¶ŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ ŸÅŸä ŸÖŸÜÿßÿ∑ŸÇ ÿ≥Ÿäÿ∑ÿ±ÿ™Ÿáÿü ŸàŸÖÿß ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÅÿßŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ÿ™ÿ∑ŸÑÿπ ÿ•ŸÑŸäŸáÿß ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿä ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇÿ®ŸÑÿü

ÿ£ÿπÿ™ŸÇÿØ ÿ£ŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¥ŸáÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸä ŸäÿπŸÜŸä ‚Äì ŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑŸäŸëÿßŸã ‚Äì ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ŸÑÿß ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿ™ŸÇŸäŸäŸÖŸá ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿØŸàÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ∑ÿ®ŸäÿπŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπÿ™ÿßÿØÿ©ÿõ ŸÑÿ£ŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÉŸÑ Ÿäÿ¥ÿπÿ±ŸàŸÜ ÿ£ŸÜ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ŸáŸä ŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÜÿ™ŸÇÿßŸÑŸäÿ©ÿå ŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ÿ™ÿ£ÿ™Ÿä ÿ®ÿπÿØ ÿßŸÜŸáŸäÿßÿ± ŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿØ ŸàŸáÿ±Ÿàÿ®Ÿáÿå Ÿàÿ≠ŸÑ ÿ£ŸÉÿ®ÿ± ŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿØŸàŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖŸÜŸäÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑÿπÿ≥ŸÉÿ±Ÿäÿ©. Ÿàÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿßŸÑŸäÿå **ÿ≠ÿßŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿ© ‚Äì ÿ•ÿ∞ÿß ÿ¨ÿßÿ≤ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿπÿ®Ÿäÿ± ‚Äì ŸÅŸä ÿ£Ÿàÿ¨Ÿáÿßÿå ŸÅŸä ÿ∞ÿ±Ÿàÿ™Ÿáÿßÿå ÿ®ÿØŸàŸÜ ÿ£Ÿä ÿ∂Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ∑ÿå ÿ®ÿØŸàŸÜ ÿ£Ÿä ŸÇŸàÿßÿπÿØÿå ŸÅŸä ÿ≠ÿßŸÑÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ÿπÿØŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ§ŸàŸÑŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸäÿ©.** ŸÑÿ£ŸÜ ŸáŸÜÿßŸÉ ÿ≥ÿπÿ© ÿ£ŸÅŸÇŸäÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÜÿ™ÿ¥ÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿßÿ¶ÿπÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿµÿßÿØÿ± ÿ∫Ÿäÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ§ŸàŸÑÿ©ÿå ŸàÿπÿØŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ£ŸÉÿØ ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿÆÿ®ÿßÿ± ŸÅŸä ÿ≠ÿßŸÑÿ© ŸÖÿ™ŸÜÿßŸÇÿ∂ÿ© ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä ŸÜÿ±Ÿâ ŸÅŸäŸá ÿßŸÑŸàÿ¨Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸä ÿßŸÑÿ•Ÿäÿ¨ÿßÿ®Ÿä ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ≥ÿßÿØÿ™ ŸÅŸä ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿß ÿ®ÿπÿØ ŸÅÿ™ÿ±ÿ© ŸÉÿ®ÿ™ ÿ∑ÿßŸÑÿ™ ÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ŸÖŸÜ ÿπŸÇŸàÿØÿå ŸÜÿ±Ÿâ ÿ£Ÿäÿ∂ÿßŸã ÿ∫Ÿäÿßÿ® ÿ£ÿØŸàÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿØŸàŸÑÿ© ÿ£Ÿà ŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿßÿ™Ÿáÿß ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ŸäŸÅÿ™ÿ±ÿ∂ ÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ŸÉŸàŸÜ ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿµÿØÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ¶Ÿäÿ≥Ÿä ŸÑŸÅŸáŸÖ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ≠ŸàŸÑÿßÿ™ÿå ÿ£Ÿà ÿßŸÑŸÖÿµÿØÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ¶Ÿäÿ≥Ÿä ŸÑŸÑÿ£ÿÆÿ®ÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ÿÆÿßÿ∑ÿ® ÿßŸÑŸÜÿßÿ≥ ÿ£Ÿà ÿ™ŸÉŸàŸÜ ŸÖÿµÿØÿ±ÿßŸã ŸÑŸÑŸÖÿπŸÑŸàŸÖÿßÿ™ ŸÖŸÜŸáÿß.

ŸÉŸäŸÅ ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿ®ŸÜÿßÿ° ÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ Ÿäÿ™ŸÖÿ™ÿπ ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿßÿü ŸàŸÖÿß ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ≠ÿØŸäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ÿπŸäŸÇ ÿ™ÿ≠ŸÇŸäŸÇ ÿ∞ŸÑŸÉ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÇÿßÿØŸÖÿ©ÿü

ÿ®ÿ™ŸÇÿØŸäÿ±Ÿäÿå ÿ£ŸàŸÑÿßŸãÿå ŸäŸÅÿ™ÿ±ÿ∂ ÿ£ŸÜ Ÿäÿ™ÿ≠ŸÖŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ¨ŸÖŸäÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ§ŸàŸÑŸäÿ© ŸÉÿ¥ÿßÿ±ÿπÿå ŸÉÿµÿ≠ŸÅŸäŸäŸÜÿå ŸÉŸÜÿÆÿ® ÿ≥Ÿäÿßÿ≥Ÿäÿ©ÿå Ÿàÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ŸÉŸàŸÜ ÿπŸÑŸâ ŸÇÿØÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ§ŸàŸÑŸäÿ©. ŸÑÿ£ŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ŸÑŸáÿß ÿÆÿµŸàÿµŸäÿ™Ÿáÿßÿå Ÿàÿ´ÿßŸÜŸäÿßŸãÿå ÿßŸÑÿ¥ŸÉŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ∑ÿ®ŸäÿπŸä ÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ÿ®ÿßÿØÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÜÿßÿ≥ÿå ÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ÿ®ÿßÿØÿ± Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÇŸàŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¨ÿ™ŸÖÿπŸäÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿäÿßÿ≥ÿ© ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ÿ•ÿπÿßÿØÿ© ÿ™ÿ±ÿ™Ÿäÿ® ÿ£Ÿàÿ±ÿßŸÇŸáÿßÿå ÿ•ÿπÿßÿØÿ© ÿ™ÿ±ÿ™Ÿäÿ® ÿ£ŸàŸÑŸàŸäÿßÿ™Ÿáÿß. Ÿàÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ŸÉŸàŸÜ ÿ•ÿ∞ÿß ŸÑŸÖ ÿ™ŸÉŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ±ÿßŸÉÿ© ŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≠ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÜ ŸÖÿπ ÿ£ÿØŸàÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿØŸàŸÑÿ© ÿ£Ÿà ÿ≥ŸÑÿ∑ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿØŸàŸÑÿ©ÿå ŸÅŸÑÿ™ŸÉŸÜ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¨Ÿáÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÇÿßÿ®ŸÑÿ©. ŸÑŸÉŸÜ ÿ™ŸÇÿØŸäÿ±Ÿä ÿ£ŸÜŸáÿß ÿ™ÿ≠ÿ™ÿßÿ¨ ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ ÿßŸÑŸàŸÇÿ™ÿå ŸÑÿ£ŸÜŸá ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿ®ÿßÿ® ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿ∂ŸàÿπŸäÿ© ŸÑÿ∫Ÿäÿßÿ® Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ™ŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ŸäŸÅÿ™ÿ±ÿ∂ ÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ŸÉŸàŸÜ ÿµŸÑÿ® ÿ£Ÿà ŸÖŸÇŸàŸÖÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸäÿ©ÿå ÿ•ŸÜ ŸàÿßŸÇÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπÿßÿ±ÿ∂ÿ© ÿ®ÿπÿØ ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÖ 2011 ŸÑŸÖ ŸäŸÉŸÜ ÿÆÿßÿ∂ÿπÿßŸã ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπŸÜŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸÇŸäŸÇŸä ŸÑÿ®ŸÜŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿßÿ™. Ÿàÿ•ÿ∞ÿß ÿ¥ÿßÿ°ÿ™ ŸàŸàÿ¨ÿØÿ™ ŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿ©ÿå ŸÅŸáŸä ÿ™ÿ≠ŸÉŸÖ ÿ¨ŸÖŸáŸàÿ±Ÿáÿß ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿä ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿ™ÿ¥ÿ± ŸÅŸä ÿ£ÿµŸÇÿßÿπ ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÑŸÖÿå ŸÅŸä ŸÉŸÑ ÿØŸàŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÑŸÖ. **ŸÅÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÑŸäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ŸÉÿßŸÜÿ™ ÿ≥ÿßÿ¶ÿØÿ© ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ ŸÅÿ™ÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπÿßÿ±ÿ∂ÿ© Ÿàÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸáÿß ŸáŸä ÿ£ŸÇÿ±ÿ® ŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ≠ŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÅŸàÿ∂Ÿâ ŸàŸÑŸäÿ≥ ÿßŸÑÿ™ŸÜÿ∏ŸäŸÖ**ÿå ŸÑÿ£ŸÜŸá ÿ£ŸÜÿ™ ŸÑÿß ÿ™ÿ≠ŸÉŸÖ ŸÅŸä ÿ¨ÿ∫ÿ±ÿßŸÅŸäÿ© ŸÖÿ≠ÿØÿØÿ©ÿå ÿ£ŸÜÿ™ ÿ™Ÿàÿ¨ŸëŸá ÿÆÿ∑ÿßÿ®ÿßŸãÿå Ÿàÿ±ÿØŸë Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿÆÿ∑ÿßÿ® ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ¨ŸÖŸáŸàÿ± ŸÑÿß ÿ™ÿÆÿ∂ÿπ ŸÑÿ£Ÿä ŸÇŸàÿßÿπÿØ.

ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÅÿ±ÿµÿ© ÿßŸÑÿßÿ≥ÿ™ÿ´ŸÜÿßÿ¶Ÿäÿ© ŸáŸä ÿ£ŸÜŸá **ÿ£ÿµÿ®ÿ≠ ŸÑŸÑÿ≥Ÿàÿ±ŸäŸäŸÜ Ÿàÿ∑ŸÜ Ÿàÿ¨ÿ∫ÿ±ÿßŸÅŸäÿß ŸäŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ≤ÿßŸÖ ÿ®ŸÇŸàÿßÿπÿØŸáÿß Ÿàÿ¢ŸÑŸäÿßÿ™Ÿáÿßÿå** ŸÉŸÖÿß ŸáŸà ŸÅŸä ÿ®ŸÇŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸÑÿØÿßŸÜÿå ÿ®ÿØÿ°Ÿãÿß ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ¨Ÿàÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿä ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ±ÿØŸÜ ÿ£Ÿà ÿßŸÑÿ¥ŸÖÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ±ŸÉŸäÿå ŸàÿµŸàŸÑŸãÿß ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ÿØŸàŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÑŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ¢ÿÆÿ±. ŸÅÿ®ÿ™ŸÇÿØŸäÿ±Ÿä ÿ£ŸÜŸá **Ÿäÿ¨ÿ® ÿ£ŸÜ ŸÜŸÉŸàŸÜ ÿµÿ±Ÿäÿ≠ŸäŸÜ ŸÖÿπ ÿ£ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ŸÜÿß Ÿàÿ™ÿ™ÿ≠ŸÖŸÑ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÇŸàŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØÿ© ŸÖÿ≥ÿ§ŸàŸÑŸäÿßÿ™Ÿáÿß Ÿàÿ£ŸàŸÑŸàŸäÿßÿ™Ÿáÿß ŸàŸàÿßÿ¨ÿ®ÿßÿ™Ÿáÿß ŸàŸàÿ∏ŸäŸÅÿ™Ÿáÿß**ÿå ŸÖŸÜ ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ ÿ£ŸàŸÑÿßŸã ÿ™ŸÜÿ∏ŸäŸÖ ÿµŸÅŸàŸÅŸáÿßÿå ŸàŸÖŸÜ ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ ÿ£ŸÜ ÿ™ŸÉŸàŸÜ ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿßŸÅÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸÇŸäŸÇŸä ŸÑŸÑÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ™. ŸàŸÑÿß ŸÜÿπŸàŸÑ ŸàŸÜŸÜÿ™ÿ∏ÿ± ÿ≠ÿ™Ÿâ ÿ™ŸÖŸÜÿ≠ŸÜÿß ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÑÿ∑ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ™ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ∑ÿ®ŸÇ ŸÖŸÜ ÿ∞Ÿáÿ®.

ŸÖÿß ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸàŸÑŸàŸäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿπÿßÿ¨ŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä Ÿäÿ¨ÿ® ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿπŸÑÿßŸÖŸäÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑÿ¨Ÿáÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑŸÅÿßÿπŸÑÿ© ÿ™ÿ≠ŸÇŸäŸÇŸáÿß ŸÑÿ∂ŸÖÿßŸÜ ÿ≠ÿ±Ÿäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ÿßŸÅÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿ≥Ÿàÿ±Ÿäÿß ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿØŸäÿØÿ©ÿü
