SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://cedmohub.eu/posts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel/): 
Content: "The false posts emerged after the news channel broadcast footage that appeared to show Israeli soldiers sexually abusing Palestinian prisoners at a military base.**¬†

‚ÄúIsrael‚Äôs Channel 12 asked a question in an Israeli public opinion poll: Do you agree with the claim that a soldier is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied? <image:4637>

Screenshot of the statement by Channel 12 posted on X, taken on August 22

AFP has fact-checked more misinformation around the Israel-Hamas war [here](https://factcheck.afp.com/list/Israeli-Palestinian-conflict)
.

![Fact Checker Logo](https://cedmo.wpengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/afp-logo-256.png)

Originally published [here](https://factcheck.afp.com/doc.afp.com.36F888X)
.

[Meta fact-check](https://cedmohub.eu/tag/meta-2/)

[](https://pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F&description=Posts+share+doctored+%26%238216%3Bprisoner+abuse+poll%26%238217%3B+from+Israeli+TV+channel&media=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F09%2Fbfdb57e90ac2b3ae59b4041b1da145361b724005-ipad-thegem-blog-timeline-large.jpg "Pinterest")
[](https://www.tumblr.com/widgets/share/tool?canonicalUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F "Tumblr")
[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F&title=Posts+share+doctored+%26%238216%3Bprisoner+abuse+poll%26%238217%3B+from+Israeli+TV+channel&summary=%22Israel%27s+Channel+12+asked+a+question+in+an+Israeli+public+opinion+poll%3A+Do+you+agree+with+the+claim+that+a+soldier+is+allowed+to+rape+a+prisoner+with+his+hands+tied%3F+47%25+Yes+43%25+No%2C%22+read+the+caption+alongside+the+altered+image+posted+on%C2%A0Facebook+on+August+11. <image:4624>

Screenshot of the false post, taken August 22, 2024

The posts emerged online after the United States [urged](https://www.barrons.com/news/us-urges-israel-to-probe-video-of-prison-sex-abuse-6316ea67)
 Israel to investigate and implement accountability following the circulation of a video that appeared to show soldiers sexually abusing a Palestinian prisoner on August 7 ([archived link](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822070528/https://www.barrons.com/news/us-urges-israel-to-probe-video-of-prison-sex-abuse-6316ea67)
).

The leaked surveillance video, broadcast on Channel 12, showed Israel soldiers hiding behind shields in what online commentators suggested was sexual acts performed on a prisoner the Sde Teiman base.

The Israeli military said it has opened an [investigation](https://www.barrons.com/news/israel-army-opens-probe-into-suspected-abuse-of-detainee-cf341d85)
 into ‚Äúsuspected abuse‚Äù of a detainee at the facility, known to be holding Palestinians arrested from Gaza during the war ([archived link](https://perma.cc/JAJ6-FJ6U)
).

Channel 12 hosted a [controversial debate](https://www.the7eye.org.il/526413)
 on August 7 in which panellists discussed whether the rape and abuse of Palestinian prisoners should be legalised ([archived link](https://perma.cc/A49R-S47W)
).

The war was triggered by Hamas‚Äôs unprecedented October 7 attack on Israel, which resulted in the deaths of 1,205 people, mostly civilians, according to an [AFP tally](https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20240903-israel-pm-unbowed-by-pressure-as-gaza-war-rages-on)
 based on Israeli official figures ([archived link](https://web.archive.org/web/20240904021154/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20240903-israel-pm-unbowed-by-pressure-as-gaza-war-rages-on)
).

Israel‚Äôs retaliatory military campaign to destroy Hamas has killed 40,819 people, according to the health ministry in the Hamas-run territory.

The altered image was shared on Facebook by users based in¬†[Malaysia](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822013834/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fzinnirahmuthalif%2Fposts%2Fpfbid023SwxWmk3NXhVA2xDdnruaXAqhSAH7y6FNtfppVPESkD7YZbhuyLyJ2n5nEcHWexNl&show_text=true&width=500)
 and [Singapore](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822014040/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fyanies14%2Fposts%2Fpfbid0MfEF2xoJ9w8YDfzj6JoTMzRmioadtsVRFNyU1F98tgA9MpsxZDA8YErHMRBd3tukl&show_text=true&width=500)
.

Similar false posts were also shared on social media platform X in [Pakistan](https://perma.cc/4PCV-CGAV)
 and the [United Kingdom](https://perma.cc/52PV-SRBE)
.

**Altered screenshot**

A reverse image search on Google found the [original footage](https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD)
 of the news bulletin segment published by Channel 12 on its website on May 27, 2022 ([archived link](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822070753/https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD)
).

The two-minute, six-second video shows an anchor presenting the news alongside the survey results that read in Hebrew: ‚ÄúDo you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?‚Äù

The video‚Äôs Hebrew-language title translates to English as: ‚ÄúA year for the government: a survey of mandates‚Äù.

The timestamp for the clip screenshot used in the misleading post can be seen at the one-minute 46-second mark.

In the manipulated image, a blue box covered the screen, hiding the original question that was displayed with the results on a screen behind the news anchor.

Channel 12 subsequently apologised for the poll, Israeli newspaper Haaretz¬†[reported](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-10-02/ty-article/.premium/leading-israeli-news-channel-apologizes-for-terror-supporters-poll/0000018a-f13e-dfa2-a99e-f97fd6ea0000)
 ([archived link](https://perma.cc/69VL-H7AJ)
).

Below is a screenshot comparison of the altered image (left) and the original video published by Channel 12 (right):

! 47% Yes 43% No,‚Äù read the caption alongside the altered image posted on¬†[Facebook](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822013834/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fzinnirahmuthalif%2Fposts%2Fpfbid023SwxWmk3NXhVA2xDdnruaXAqhSAH7y6FNtfppVPESkD7YZbhuyLyJ2n5nEcHWexNl&show_text=true&width=500)
 on August 11.

The image appeared to show a news presenter from Israel‚Äôs Channel 12 standing next to a poll graphic with a Hebrew-language question that translates as: ‚ÄúDo you agree that a soldier is allowed to rape a ‚Äúterrorist‚Äù?‚Äù

###### **Israel‚Äôs Channel 12 has said it did not broadcast a purported poll circulating on social media in August 2024 about the treatment of prisoners by the Israeli army as the Gaza war raged. [Scroll Top](#page)

Screenshot comparison of the altered image (left) and the original video published by Channel 12 (right)

Alon Shani, a spokesman from Channel 12, told AFP on August 21: ‚ÄúWe are aware and we published a fake alert shortly after this was spread online.‚Äù

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from AFP Malaysia states that the image is a doctored screenshot of a poll from Israel's Channel 12. The original video was published on May 27, 2022, and the altered image was shared on Facebook on August 11. The original question was about the government's reliance on supporters of terrorism. The altered image shows a question about whether a soldier is allowed to rape a prisoner. Channel 12 has debunked the false posts. <image:4637>, <image:4624>, <image:4622>. The article was published on September 4, 2024.

In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

From [Source](https://komonews.com/news/nation-world/squad-member-shares-fake-poll-claiming-most-israelis-support-rape-of-palestinians-rashida-tlaib-noura-erakat-alex-zeldin-ritchie-torres-israel-palestine-hamas-war-terrorism-gaza): 
Content: "

The screenshots show the image originally shared by Erakat said 47% of respondents answered "yes" to a poll asking "do you agree that a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian?" Various X users later claimed the image was a doctored version of a 2022 Channel 12 poll, which asked respondents about the Israeli government's relationship with "terrorist supporters."

An analysis of a May 27, 2022 Channel 12 [broadcast](https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD "https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD")
 by The National Desk (TND) confirmed the claims.

WASHINGTON (TND) ‚Äî Rep. Erakat's now-deleted X post contained a doctored image of a poll seemingly conducted by Israel's Channel 12, according to [screenshots](https://x.com/yashar/status/1821337704711516313 "https://x.com/yashar/status/1821337704711516313")
 shared by users. She noted the image circulated shortly after video was released of an alleged gang rape of a Palestinian prisoner by Israeli soldiers at detention facilitySde Teiman.

State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller on Wednesday called for an investigation related to the video, emphasizing claims of sexual abuse atSde Teiman are "horrific." Israel's Supreme Court has repeatedly convened to consider closingthe facility.

Erakat told TND it is "devastating" for Palestinian-Americans to see such footage, adding both a lack of media coverage and the outrage she and Rep. <image:4640>](https://komonews.com/game-center#/games/guessword)

'Squad' member shares fake poll claiming most Israelis support rape of Palestinians
===================================================================================

* * *

by KRISTINA WATROBSKI | The National Desk

Fri, August 9th 2024 at 1:45 PM

Updated Fri, August 9th 2024 at 3:36 PM

![UserWay icon for accessibility widget](/resources/defaults/news_3.0/icons/accessibility/userway-transparent.svg)

![FILE - Rep. Ritchie Torres, D-N.Y., also [condemned](https://x.com/RitchieTorres/status/1821941043035594962 "https://x.com/RitchieTorres/status/1821941043035594962")
 the doctored image, calling "disinformation" a "new enemy of Israel on the social media age."

> A fake poll falsely accusing Israelis of endorsing rape against Palestinians is dangerous disinformation designed to delegitimize and demonize both the Jewish People and the Jewish State," the congressman said. Tlaib trusted me & posting this \[without\] cross checking was my mistake."  

"But surely u understand how one would take this poll to be true in light of video of gang rape of a Palestinian detainee & Knesset + public debate on whether such rape should be ok," she added. "THAT is the disgrace, Alex."  

When reached for comment, Erakat reiterated to TND that it is "not a leap or a stretch" to believe such a poll would have been published by Channel 12. Rashida Tlaib, D-Mich., is drawing backlash for sharing a social media post which falsely claimed most Israeli citizens believe soldiers can sexually assault Palestinians.

Noura Erakat, a prominent Palestinian-American activist and Rutgers University professor, initially made the post Wednesday. Tlaib drew backlash for sharing the post, including from Forward columnist Alex Zeldin, who [called](https://x.com/JewishWonk/status/1821335110844575919 "https://x.com/JewishWonk/status/1821335110844575919")
 the congresswoman "a disgrace."

"Why is Rashida Tlaib, a Member of Congress, openly distributing fake polls claiming an American ally is pro-rape?" Zeldin wrote on X."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from The National Desk states that a doctored image of a poll was shared on social media, falsely claiming that most Israelis support the rape of Palestinians. The original image was a poll from Channel 12, but the question was altered. The article mentions that the image was shared by Noura Erakat and Rashida Tlaib. The article was published on August 9, 2024.

_________________________

# Search Result
From [Source](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/08/65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees/): 
Content: "[Opinion](https://mondoweiss.net/opinion/)

65% of Israeli Jews oppose criminal prosecution for soldiers suspected of raping Palestinian detainees
======================================================================================================

A shocking new poll shows that almost two out of three Jewish Israelis oppose criminal prosecution for soldiers suspected of gang-raping Palestinian detainees at the Sde Teiman torture facility.

By [Jonathan Ofir](https://mondoweiss.net/author/jonathan-ofir/ "Posts by Jonathan Ofir")
 August 19, 2024 [28](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/08/65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees/#comments "Comments")

[](https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/email?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fmondoweiss.net%2F2024%2F08%2F65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees%2F&linkname=65%25%20of%20Israeli%20Jews%20oppose%20criminal%20prosecution%20for%20soldiers%20suspected%20of%20raping%20Palestinian%20detainees "Email")
[](https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/print?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fmondoweiss.net%2F2024%2F08%2F65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees%2F&linkname=65%25%20of%20Israeli%20Jews%20oppose%20criminal%20prosecution%20for%20soldiers%20suspected%20of%20raping%20Palestinian%20detainees "Print")

A shocking [poll](https://www.inss.org.il/he/publication/august-2024/)
 published on August 18 by the Israeli Institute for National Security Studies surveys attitudes concerning various aspects of what Israel calls ‚ÄúSwords of Iron‚Äù ‚Äî the genocide of the last ten months and counting.¬†

The poll asks, among else, how people would want to handle the soldiers suspected of [gang-raping Palestinian detainees at the Sde Teiman torture facility](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/08/israeli-medias-coverage-of-the-rape-of-palestinian-detainees-shows-support-for-sexual-violence-in-service-of-genocide/)
 if it turned out that the suspicions were strong. It confirms what we saw last week when Israeli journalist Yehuda Shlezinger lamented on Israel‚Äôs mainstream Channel 12 [how gang rape is not an approved and regulated policy](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/08/israeli-medias-coverage-of-the-rape-of-palestinian-detainees-shows-support-for-sexual-violence-in-service-of-genocide/)
 in Israeli detention centers.¬†

That figure, 65%, also echoes the February [poll](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/02/over-2-3-of-jewish-israelis-oppose-humanitarian-aid-to-palestinians-starving-in-gaza/)
 saying that 68% of Jewish Israelis¬† ‚Äúoppose the transfer of humanitarian aid to Gaza residents at this time,‚Äù even if Hamas or UNRWA were out of the picture in terms of distribution.¬†

The same INSS poll citing the 65% opposing criminal prosecution of the gang rapists incidentally cites an identical percentage of Israeli Jews as having ‚Äúhigh trust‚Äù in the reports of the military spokesperson ‚Äúthroughout the war in Gaza‚Äù ‚Äî an institution which generates incessant [genocide propaganda](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/03/the-real-reason-israel-stormed-al-shifa-hospital-yet-again/)
. There, they only offer a data tracker on six points, but it doesn‚Äôt include the Hebrew survey with its 23 points.¬†

So this is yet another unbelievable data point ‚Äî gang rape as a weapon of war is not considered criminal by two out of three Jewish Israelis when it‚Äôs Israeli soldiers doing it to Palestinians (in the much-publicized gang rape case, the victim happens to be a civil servant, a policeman for the drug control department in Jabalia).¬†

When it comes to Palestinians, the blanket suspicion of affiliation with Hamas generates a rationale for revenge by which Palestinians are assumed to be involved with sexual violence, and when we speak about ‚Äúdisciplinary measures‚Äù here, it is not just systemic torture and sexual violence, it also reaches the level of murder through torture. Two-thirds of Jewish Israelis are saying that there is simply nothing criminal here ‚Äî only ‚Äúbad behavior,‚Äù at worst.¬†

And this seems to strengthen the pattern that has been documented: not only do Israelis seem to generally enjoy watching [snuff videos](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/03/we-are-the-masters-of-the-house-israeli-channels-air-snuff-videos-featuring-systematic-torture-of-palestinians/)
 of this systemic torture ‚Äî they generally support the sexual violence, including rape, that has accompanied it. In addition to wishing a ‚Äúregulated policy‚Äù of rape existed in Israeli prisons, Shlezinger also advocated that the ‚Äúterrorists‚Äù be ‚Äúexecuted according to law.‚Äù And he shared that belief during his _apology_ for his rape advocacy.

It is a whole other world of impunity for Israeli soldiers. 65%, almost two out of three Jewish Israelis, opposed criminal prosecution, and would prefer them be ‚Äúhandled in a disciplinary manner, by the commanding level only.‚Äù

The survey asked the question:

> ‚ÄúRecently, the military prosecution requested to extend the arrest of the five soldiers suspected of gross abuse, and clarified that there is added evidence which strengthens the suspicion against them. In your opinion, if it turns out that there is basis for the suspicion against the suspects, in which way should they be handled?‚Äù¬†

Only 21% of Jewish Israelis answered that ‚Äúthey should stand criminal trial‚Äù; 14% of Jewish Israelis didn‚Äôt know.¬†¬†

It is now clear, that the torture of Palestinians in this network of torture camps is systemic, as also documented by B‚Äôtselem in their report ‚Äú[Welcome to Hell: The Israeli Prison System as a Network of Torture Camps](https://www.btselem.org/press_releases/20240805_welcome_to_hell)
.‚Äù High brass is involved in this, so the idea that the gang rapists would be disciplined by their own commanders is tantamount to letting them off the hook. There is almost nothing they can do to Palestinians that the Jewish Israeli public would consider criminal, and hardly any Israelis would consider them ‚Äúhuman animals‚Äù for thinking like that.¬†

_Correction: The story originally incorrectly said that ‚Äú28% of Jewish Israelis answered that ‚Äòthey should stand criminal trial.'‚Äù The correct percentage is 21%. The story has been updated._

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

0min

Explosion in Tel Aviv building, bomb disposal experts on site: Israeli police

A powerful explosion of unknown origin went off in a building in Tel Aviv before 4:00 am (0100 GMT), Israeli police said Friday.  
  
"Numerous police officers and bomb disposal experts have arrived on the scene and are dealing with the situation," police said in a statement without giving further details.  
  
AFP

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The LBC Group website published an article on July 19, 2024, about an explosion in a Tel Aviv building. The article mentions that Israeli police and bomb disposal experts were on the scene. The article includes an image of the aftermath of the explosion <image:2339>.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```

The Times of Israel liveblogged Saturday‚Äôs events as they unfolded.

[3:40 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-sderot-kibbutz-nir-am/)

#### [Rocket sirens sound in Sderot, Kibbutz Nir Am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-sderot-kibbutz-nir-am/)

Sirens warning of incoming rocket attacks sound again in southern Israel. They are heard in Sderot, Kibbutz Nir Am, Yad Mordechai, and Netiv Ha‚Äôasara, all near the Gaza Strip.

Earlier overnight, a home in Sderot suffered a direct rocket hit, causing no injuries but significant damage.

[3:17 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sderot-mayor-decries-massacre-of-innocent-civilians-calls-to-erase-hamas/)

#### [Sderot mayor decries ‚Äòmassacre of innocent civilians,‚Äô calls to erase Hamas](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sderot-mayor-decries-massacre-of-innocent-civilians-calls-to-erase-hamas/)

Sderot Mayor Alon Davidi tells residents to stay in their homes behind locked doors and not open them until instructed otherwise, as Israeli security forces work to find and apprehend an unknown number of Palestinian terrorists who infiltrated this morning from Gaza into Israeli communities and gunned down people in the streets and in their homes.

Davidi decries the ‚Äúmassacre of innocent civilians everywhere,‚Äù and calls for Israel‚Äôs leadership to deal a significant blow to Hamas.

‚ÄúWe need to take over Gaza and kill them, they need to be erased,‚Äù he tells Channel 12.

[3:07 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-kibbutz-beeri-where-israeli-forces-battle-palestinian-terrorists/)

#### [Rocket sirens sound in Kibbutz Be‚Äôeri where Israeli forces battle Palestinian terrorists](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-kibbutz-beeri-where-israeli-forces-battle-palestinian-terrorists/)

Sirens warning of incoming rockets are sounding in Kibbutz Be‚Äôeri in southern Israel where Israeli security forces and Palestinian terrorists who infiltrated into the kibbutz from Gaza are engaged in a gun battle.

Hebrew media reports say Israeli forces are still working to clear the kibbutz of terrorists and exchanges of gunfire can be heard.

Earlier, dozens of people were rescued from the kibbutz dining hall where they were held hostage for hours. According to public broadcaster Kan, at least 48 people were rescued in the incident.

[3:02 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/woman-seriously-injured-in-rocket-hit-in-ashkelon-five-more-lightly-wounded/)

#### [Woman seriously injured in rocket hit in Ashkelon, five more lightly wounded](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/woman-seriously-injured-in-rocket-hit-in-ashkelon-five-more-lightly-wounded/)

The Magen David Adom ambulance services says a 50-year-old woman was seriously injured in a rocket attack in Ashkelon tonight, and five other sustained light injuries.

The Barzilai Medical Center in the city was hit by a rocket launched from the Gaza Strip amid the ongoing, unprecedented attack on Israel.

[2:44 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/barzilai-hospital-in-ashkelon-suffers-rocket-hit-no-injuries-reported/)

#### [Barzilai hospital in Ashkelon suffers rocket hit; no injuries reported](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/barzilai-hospital-in-ashkelon-suffers-rocket-hit-no-injuries-reported/)

The Barzilai Medical Center in the southern city of Ashkelon is hit by a rocket fired from the Gaza Strip. The rocket struck a bridge between buildings at the hospital.

There are no immediate reports of injuries, but significant damage was sustained, a hospital official tells Channel 12.

[2:39 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-hostages-rescued-in-ofakim-terrorists-killed/)

#### [Two Israeli hostages rescued in Ofakim; terrorists killed](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-hostages-rescued-in-ofakim-terrorists-killed/)

Two Israelis who were taken hostage in a home in the southern town of Ofakim have been rescued by Israeli security forces, according to Hebrew-language media.

Four terrorists at the home were killed, according to the reports. At least one member of Israel‚Äôs security forces was injured.

[2:35 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/security-cabinet-says-israel-will-destroy-military-governmental-abilities-of-hamas-islamic-jihad/)

#### [Security cabinet says Israel will destroy military, governmental abilities of Hamas, Islamic Jihad](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/security-cabinet-says-israel-will-destroy-military-governmental-abilities-of-hamas-islamic-jihad/)

By [ToI Staff](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/times-of-israel-staff/ "ToI Staff")

The Prime Minister‚Äôs Office says the security cabinet ended its meeting tonight, following a day of unprecedented attacks by Hamas against Israelis, and has made a ‚Äúseries of operational decisions aimed at bringing about the destruction of the military and governmental capabilities of Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad.‚Äù

His office says Israel‚Äôs response will take away ‚Äútheir ability and desire to threaten and harm the citizens of Israel for many years.‚Äù

Among the decisions made by the cabinet are stopping the supply of electricity, fuel and goods to the Gaza Strip.

[2:26 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-says-israel-embarking-on-long-and-difficult-war/)

#### [Netanyahu says Israel embarking on ‚Äòlong and difficult war‚Äô](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-says-israel-embarking-on-long-and-difficult-war/)

By [ToI Staff](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/times-of-israel-staff/ "ToI Staff")

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel is ‚Äúembarking on a long and difficult war‚Äù that was ‚Äúforced upon us by a murderous attack by Hamas‚Äù throughout the day.

The first phase of the war, he [writes](https://twitter.com/netanyahu/status/1710796924092129517)
 on X, involves ‚Äúdestroying most of the enemy forces‚Äù that have infiltrated into Israel and have killed civilians and soldiers.

Israel has also begun an offensive into Gaza ‚Äúand it will continue without hesitation and without respite ‚Äì until the goals are achieved.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe will restore security to the citizens of Israel and we will win,‚Äù he writes.

[2:19 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-spokesperson-in-arabic-warns-gaza-residents-to-seek-shelter/)

#### [IDF spokesperson in Arabic warns Gaza residents to seek shelter](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-spokesperson-in-arabic-warns-gaza-residents-to-seek-shelter/)

[![Avichay Adraee's official IDF photo, via Facebook (photo credit: Publicity)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2013/01/avichay-640x400.png "Avichay Adraee's official IDF photo, via Facebook (photo credit: Publicity)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-spokesperson-in-arabic-warns-gaza-residents-to-seek-shelter/)

Avichay Adraee's official IDF photo, via Facebook (photo credit: Publicity)

The IDF‚Äôs spokesperson in Arabic has issued a message to residents of the Gaza Strip to seek shelter amid an ongoing Israeli response to Hamas‚Äô deadly, multi-front attack against soldiers and civilians in Israel since this morning.

On X, the IDF‚Äôs Arabic-language spokesman Avichay Adraee told residents that ‚ÄúHamas‚Äô operations are forcing the IDF to operate in your place of residence. For your safety, you must leave your place of residence immediately.‚Äù

[2:17 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sirens-wail-in-southern-israel/)

#### [Sirens wail in southern Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sirens-wail-in-southern-israel/)

Sirens warning of incoming rocket attacks are sounding in southern Israel.

They are heard in Ashkelon and communities near the Gaza Strip.

[1:57 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/uk-pm-sunak-slams-barbarity-of-hamas-attack-on-israel/)

#### [UK PM Sunak slams ‚Äòbarbarity‚Äô of Hamas attack on Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/uk-pm-sunak-slams-barbarity-of-hamas-attack-on-israel/)

[![Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak delivers the opening speech on the first day of the Ukraine Recovery Conference in London on June 21, 2023. (Henry Nicholls/Pool/AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/06/33KL2KL-highres-e1687361331173-640x400.jpg "Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak delivers the opening speech on the first day of the Ukraine Recovery Conference in London on June 21, 2023. (Henry Nicholls/Pool/AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/uk-pm-sunak-slams-barbarity-of-hamas-attack-on-israel/)

Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak delivers the opening speech on the first day of the Ukraine Recovery Conference in London on June 21, 2023. (Henry Nicholls/Pool/AFP)

UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak condemns the ‚Äúbarbarity‚Äù of Hamas attacks on Israel, building on his original comments.

‚ÄúAs the barbarity of today‚Äôs atrocities becomes clearer, we stand unequivocally with Israel,‚Äù he writes on X. ‚ÄúThis attack by Hamas is cowardly and depraved.‚Äù

[1:41 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-in-hamas-onslaught-rises-to-at-least-300/)

#### [Israeli death toll in Hamas onslaught rises to at least 300](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-in-hamas-onslaught-rises-to-at-least-300/)

[![An Israeli soldier stands by the bodies of people killed by Palestinian terrorists who entered from the Gaza Strip, in the southern Israeli city of Sderot, October 7, 2023. (AP Photo/ Tsafrir Abayov)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/AP23280378742461-640x400.jpg "An Israeli soldier stands by the bodies of people killed by Palestinian terrorists who entered from the Gaza Strip, in the southern Israeli city of Sderot, October 7, 2023. (AP Photo/ Tsafrir Abayov)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-in-hamas-onslaught-rises-to-at-least-300/)

An Israeli soldier stands by the bodies of people killed by Palestinian terrorists who entered from the Gaza Strip, in the southern Israeli city of Sderot, October 7, 2023. (AP Photo/ Tsafrir Abayov)

The death toll from the Hamas terror group‚Äôs massive multi-front attack on Israel rises to more than 300, Hebrew-language media reports say, citing medical officials.

The toll is expected to continue to rise.

At least 1,590 have been wounded, many seriously.

Dozens of civilians as well as IDF soldiers are believed to have been abducted and brought into Gaza; Hamas has boasted that the number of hostages is higher than Israel knows.

[1:36 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-it-killed-7-terrorists-attempting-to-infiltrate-israel-via-zikim-beach/)

#### [IDF says it killed 7 terrorists attempting to infiltrate Israel via Zikim Beach](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-it-killed-7-terrorists-attempting-to-infiltrate-israel-via-zikim-beach/)

The IDF says it killed seven terrorists attempting to enter Israel via the Zikim Beach just north of Gaza.

The IDF says it prevented the terrorists from infiltrating into Israeli communities.

The military also says that it also recently struck three operational sites being used by Hamas in Gaza.

[1:32 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/senior-white-house-official-us-ready-to-offer-all-means-of-support-to-israel/)

#### [Senior White House official: US ready to offer ‚Äòall means of support‚Äô to Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/senior-white-house-official-us-ready-to-offer-all-means-of-support-to-israel/)

By [Lazar Berman](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/lazar-berman/ "Lazar Berman")

[![US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, left, listens as US President Joe Biden speaks in the State Dining Room of the White House, October 7, 2023, in Washington, about the situation in Israel. (AP Photo/Manuel Balce Ceneta)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/AP23280694625329-640x400.jpg "US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, left, listens as US President Joe Biden speaks in the State Dining Room of the White House, October 7, 2023, in Washington, about the situation in Israel. (AP Photo/Manuel Balce Ceneta)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/senior-white-house-official-us-ready-to-offer-all-means-of-support-to-israel/)

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, left, listens as US President Joe Biden speaks in the State Dining Room of the White House, October 7, 2023, in Washington, about the situation in Israel. (AP Photo/Manuel Balce Ceneta)

A senior Biden administration official says on a call with reporters that the US ‚Äúwill treat Hamas for what they are. They are an international terrorist organization.‚Äù

Washington‚Äôs focus is currently on ‚Äúensuring that the Israelis have what they need to respond appropriately,‚Äù says the official.

The White House official says the US is ready ‚Äúto offer all appropriate means of support to the people and government of Israel.‚Äù

‚ÄúIsrael has a right to defend itself and its people. Full stop.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe remain deeply aligned,‚Äù said the official, adding that Israel‚Äôs response is likely to continue ‚Äúfor some time.

The official says that that US will continue to ‚Äúwork with parties throughout the region‚Äù to make sure the fighting doesn‚Äôt spread from Gaza.

The official also speaks about the potential of a normalization deal between Israel and Saudi Arabia, saying that it is ‚Äúpremature to say the impact‚Äù that the war will have on those efforts.

‚ÄúThat process has a ways to travel,‚Äù says the official, adding that ‚Äúterrorist groups like Hamas will not derail any such outcome.‚Äù

[1:25 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/family-of-kidnapped-israeli-shares-video-of-her-abduction-by-hamas/)

#### [Family of kidnapped Israeli shares video of her abduction by Hamas](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/family-of-kidnapped-israeli-shares-video-of-her-abduction-by-hamas/)

[![Israeli Noa Argamani is seen being kidnapped by Hamas terrorist in the south on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot used in accordance with clause 27a of the copyright law)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/arg-640x400.jpg "Israeli Noa Argamani is seen being kidnapped by Hamas terrorist in the south on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot used in accordance with clause 27a of the copyright law)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/family-of-kidnapped-israeli-shares-video-of-her-abduction-by-hamas/)

Israeli Noa Argamani is seen being kidnapped by Hamas terrorist in the south on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot used in accordance with clause 27a of the copyright law)

The family of Noa Argamani is sharing harrowing footage of her abduction in southern Israel earlier today.

The video shows her being taken away on the back of a motorcycle by Hamas terrorists as she screams ‚Äúdon‚Äôt kill me‚Äù and stretches her arms out to her boyfriend, Avi Natan, who is also being held by Hamas operatives. They were both attending a festival in the south.

Other footage shows Argamani being held in Gaza sipping from a cup of water.

> Her name is Noa.
> 
> Her crime was going to a music festival in southern Israel. She was kidnapped by Hamas terrorists. I call on the international community to act against this vicious war crime and ensure all the Israelis will return home safely. [pic.twitter.com/CiZcsD5eka](https://t.co/CiZcsD5eka)
> 
> ‚Äî Hananya Naftali (@HananyaNaftali) [October 7, 2023](https://twitter.com/HananyaNaftali/status/1710763682219581916?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Israel has confirmed that civilians and soldiers have been abducted and taken into Gaza but have not given a number. Dozens are feared to be held by the terror group, including children and the elderly.

[1:21 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hostage-situation-in-kibbutz-dining-hall-said-to-be-resolved-hostages-rescued-safely/)

#### [Hostage situation in kibbutz dining hall said to be resolved, hostages rescued safely](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hostage-situation-in-kibbutz-dining-hall-said-to-be-resolved-hostages-rescued-safely/)

The ongoing hostage situation in the dining hall of Kibbutz Be‚Äôeri has reportedly been resolved and the hostages rescued.

According to a number of Hebrew media reports, the terrorists who were holding them were neutralized.

[1:21 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-number-of-israeli-hostages-in-gaza-much-higher-than-netanyahu-thinks/)

#### [Hamas: Number of Israeli hostages in Gaza much higher than Netanyahu thinks](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-number-of-israeli-hostages-in-gaza-much-higher-than-netanyahu-thinks/)

By [Gianluca Pacchiani](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gianluca-pacchiani/ "Gianluca Pacchiani")

[![Palestinians ride on an Israeli military vehicle taken by an army base inside Israel overrun by Hamas, in Gaza City, October 7, 2023. (AP/Abed Abu Reash)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/AP23280631988635-640x400.jpg "Palestinians ride on an Israeli military vehicle taken by an army base inside Israel overrun by Hamas, in Gaza City, October 7, 2023. (AP/Abed Abu Reash)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-number-of-israeli-hostages-in-gaza-much-higher-than-netanyahu-thinks/)

Palestinians ride on an Israeli military vehicle taken by an army base inside Israel overrun by Hamas, in Gaza City, October 7, 2023. (AP/Abed Abu Reash)

In a statement to Hamas‚Äôs Al-Aqsa TV, the terror group‚Äôs military spokesman Abu Ubaida claims that the number of hostages taken into Gaza is ‚Äúmany times greater than what Netanyahu thinks,‚Äù and that they are being held in various locations throughout the coastal strip.

The spokesman also urges Israel not to make ‚Äúmiscalculations,‚Äù adding that ‚Äúwhatever happens to the people of the Gaza Strip, will happen to \[the hostages\].‚Äù

Israel is now facing a deep crisis after witnessing the heroism of Hamas militants, Abu Ubaida says, adding that Israeli soldiers fell before them ‚Äúlike locusts.‚Äù

He vows that Hamas will continue the ongoing operation on all fronts.

[1:10 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/blinken-speaks-with-egyptian-fm-urges-halt-to-hamas-attacks/)

#### [Blinken speaks with Egyptian FM, urges halt to Hamas attacks](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/blinken-speaks-with-egyptian-fm-urges-halt-to-hamas-attacks/)

[![Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry addresses a joint press conference to comment on the Ministerial Meeting on the Middle East Peace Process, on May 11, 2023 at the Foreign Office in Berlin. (Photo by Odd ANDERSEN / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/05/33EU876-highres-640x400.jpg "Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry addresses a joint press conference to comment on the Ministerial Meeting on the Middle East Peace Process, on May 11, 2023 at the Foreign Office in Berlin. (Photo by Odd ANDERSEN / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/blinken-speaks-with-egyptian-fm-urges-halt-to-hamas-attacks/)

Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry addresses a joint press conference to comment on the Ministerial Meeting on the Middle East Peace Process, on May 11, 2023 at the Foreign Office in Berlin. (Photo by Odd ANDERSEN / AFP)

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken speaks with his Egyptian counterpart, Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry.

According to the US State Department, Blinken calls for ‚Äúan immediate halt to the appalling assault by Hamas terrorists against Israel‚Äù and also expresses US appreciation for ‚Äúfor the Egyptian leadership‚Äôs ongoing efforts‚Äù in attempting to reduce tensions.

[12:53 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sounding-in-sderot-shaar-hanegev/)

#### [Rocket sirens sounding in Sderot, Sha‚Äôar Hanegev](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sounding-in-sderot-shaar-hanegev/)

[![Salvo of rockets fired by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza City toward Israel on October 7, 2023 (EYAD BABA / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XP9AR-highres-640x400.jpg "Salvo of rockets fired by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza City toward Israel on October 7, 2023 (EYAD BABA / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sounding-in-sderot-shaar-hanegev/)

Salvo of rockets fired by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza City toward Israel on October 7, 2023 (EYAD BABA / AFP)

Rocket alert sirens sound in Sderot, Sha‚Äôar Hanegev and other Gaza border communities.

[12:44 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/health-ministry-says-close-to-1600-wounded-today/)

#### [Health Ministry says close to 1,600 wounded today](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/health-ministry-says-close-to-1600-wounded-today/)

[![Wounded Israeli soldiers arrive at the Hadassah Ein Kerem Hospital in Jerusalem, October 7, 2023. (Noam Revkin Fenton/Flash90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/F231007NRF41-640x400.jpg "Wounded Israeli soldiers arrive at the Hadassah Ein Kerem Hospital in Jerusalem, October 7, 2023. (Noam Revkin Fenton/Flash90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/health-ministry-says-close-to-1600-wounded-today/)

Wounded Israeli soldiers arrive at the Hadassah Ein Kerem Hospital in Jerusalem, October 7, 2023. (Noam Revkin Fenton/Flash90)

The Health Ministry says in an update that at least 1,590 people were wounded and being treated in hospitals today.

As of 11:30 p.m., there are 19 in critical condition, 293 in serious condition, 315 in moderate condition, 715 in mild condition, 20 being treated for severe anxiety and 181 still being evaluated by medical officials.

More than 250 are thought to be have been killed, with that figure expected to rise.

[12:42 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-it-struck-2-hamas-operation-sites-inside-gaza-mosques/)

#### [IDF says it struck 2 Hamas operation sites inside Gaza mosques](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-it-struck-2-hamas-operation-sites-inside-gaza-mosques/)

[![A ball of fire and smoke rises above a building in Gaza City on October 7, 2023 during an Israeli air strike. (MAHMUD HAMS / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XQ6MD-highres-640x400.jpg "A ball of fire and smoke rises above a building in Gaza City on October 7, 2023 during an Israeli air strike. (MAHMUD HAMS / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-it-struck-2-hamas-operation-sites-inside-gaza-mosques/)

A ball of fire and smoke rises above a building in Gaza City on October 7, 2023 during an Israeli air strike. (MAHMUD HAMS / AFP)

The Israel Defense Forces says that earlier today it struck two ‚Äúoperational infrastuctures‚Äù in Gaza that were housed inside mosques and were being used by Hamas to direct terror toward Israel.

The IDF slams Hamas for using ‚Äúholy sites‚Äù and exploiting the civilian population in the Gaza Strip.

[12:34 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/retired-idf-major-general-recounts-rescuing-his-family-in-nahal-oz/)

#### [Retired IDF major general recounts rescuing his family in Nahal Oz](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/retired-idf-major-general-recounts-rescuing-his-family-in-nahal-oz/)

[![Illustrative -- A vehicle blocks road near Nahal Oz in southern Israel on March 25, 2019. (Hadas Parush/Flash90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2022/08/F190325HP02-640x400.jpg "Illustrative -- A vehicle blocks road near Nahal Oz in southern Israel on March 25, 2019. (Hadas Parush/Flash90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/retired-idf-major-general-recounts-rescuing-his-family-in-nahal-oz/)

Illustrative -- A vehicle blocks road near Nahal Oz in southern Israel on March 25, 2019. (Hadas Parush/Flash90)

Maj.-Gen. (retired) Noam Tibon describes to Channel 12 going to Kibbutz Nahal Oz and, together with IDF troops, ‚Äúsaving my family‚Äù whose home was surrounded by terrorists from Gaza.

He tells Channel 12 that the troops killed several terrorists and rescued his son and grandchildren.

His son, Amir, a journalist for Haaretz, posts on the social media platform X that his ‚Äúheroic‚Äù father came from Tel Aviv, ‚Äúled the troops‚Äù to the family‚Äôs home and ‚Äúhelped kill the terrorists.‚Äù

Amir also praises his daughters for staying quiet in the house for hours before they were rescued. ‚ÄúWe are praying for the neighbors who are missing and injured.‚Äù

[12:21 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/nepalese-nationals-among-those-wounded-in-hamas-assault-reportedly-among-abducted/)

#### [Nepalese nationals among those wounded in Hamas assault, reportedly among abducted](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/nepalese-nationals-among-those-wounded-in-hamas-assault-reportedly-among-abducted/)

By [Gavriel Fiske](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gavriel-fiske/ "Gavriel Fiske")

[![Israeli rescue teams evacuate a wounded person near the southern city of Sderot on October 7, 2023, after the Palestinian terror group Hamas launched a large-scale surprise attack on Israel. (Menahem KAHANA / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XQ3LH-highres-640x400.jpg "Israeli rescue teams evacuate a wounded person near the southern city of Sderot on October 7, 2023, after the Palestinian terror group Hamas launched a large-scale surprise attack on Israel. (Menahem KAHANA / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/nepalese-nationals-among-those-wounded-in-hamas-assault-reportedly-among-abducted/)

Israeli rescue teams evacuate a wounded person near the southern city of Sderot on October 7, 2023, after the Palestinian terror group Hamas launched a large-scale surprise attack on Israel. (Menahem KAHANA / AFP)

Eleven Nepalese agricultural students have been injured, two of them seriously, in the Hamas attack on southern Israel, according to a statement by the Nepalese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

Nepal‚Äôs ambassador to Israel tells CNN that when the attack began, the students were working on a farm in the area. They hid in a bomb shelter but that building was taken over by Hamas.

Separate unconfirmed reports in the Hindustani Times and India Today state that some Nepalese students are also among those who have been taken hostage by Hamas.

[12:10 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-its-strikes-on-gaza-hit-rocket-launchers-terror-cell-hamas-hq/)

#### [IDF says its strikes on Gaza hit rocket launchers, terror cell, Hamas HQ](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-its-strikes-on-gaza-hit-rocket-launchers-terror-cell-hamas-hq/)

(MAHMUD HAMS / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XQ6MD-highres-640x400.jpg "A ball of fire and smoke rises above a building in Gaza City on October 7, 2023 during an Israeli air strike. A ball of fire and smoke rises above a building in Gaza City on October 7, 2023 during an Israeli air strike. (MAHMUD HAMS / AFP)

The Israel Defenses Forces provides details on a number of airstrikes it carried out in the Gaza Strip in the last few hours.

The IDF says it carried out a drone strike on a rocket launcher, and killed two terrorists standing next to it.

In other drone strikes, a terror cell was hit while attempting to infiltrate into Israel via Zikim beach, and another cell was hit while trying to infiltrate from central Gaza, the IDF says.

> IDF says it struck a rocket launcher in the Gaza Strip and two terrorists standing next to it. In other drone strikes, a terror cell was hit while attempting to infiltrate into Israel via the Zikim beach, and another cell was hit while trying to infiltrate from central Gaza.‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/4h0Ky8TAXB](https://t.co/4h0Ky8TAXB)

> ‚Äî Emanuel (Mannie) Fabian (@manniefabian) [October 7, 2023](https://twitter.com/manniefabian/status/1710760328936431983?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Fighter jets, meanwhile, targeted a Hamas operational headquarters used by the terror group to carry out rocket attacks, and a headquarters belonging to the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, the IDF says

Footage published by the IDF shows several recent strikes in the Gaza Strip.

[11:59 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/saudi-fm-calls-for-immediate-halt-to-escalation-and-rejects-targeting-of-civilians/)

#### [Saudi FM calls for ‚Äòimmediate halt to escalation‚Äô and rejects ‚Äòtargeting of civilians‚Äô](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/saudi-fm-calls-for-immediate-halt-to-escalation-and-rejects-targeting-of-civilians/)

By [AP](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/ap/ "AP")

[![US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, left, shakes hands with Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan during a joint news conference at the Intercontinental Hotel in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, June 8, 2023. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, left, shakes hands with Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan during a joint news conference at the Intercontinental Hotel in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, June 8, 2023. (Ahmed Yosri/Pool Photo via AP)

Saudi Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan speaks with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken to urge a halt to the violence in and around Gaza.

A Saudi Foreign Ministry statement says the two discussed ‚Äúthe necessity of working toward an immediate halt to the escalation.‚Äù

Prince Faisal emphasizes ‚Äúthe kingdom‚Äôs rejection of the targeting of civilians and the need for all sides to respect international humanitarian law.‚Äù

The Saudis have been in talks with the White House over potentially forging diplomatic relations with Israel, efforts which have now been thrown into question.

[11:54 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/germany-france-step-up-security-at-jewish-sites-amid-israel-war/)

#### [Germany, France step up security at Jewish sites amid Israel war](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/germany-france-step-up-security-at-jewish-sites-amid-israel-war/)

By [AFP](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/afp/ "AFP")

[![A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/05/8UG8RN-highres-640x400.jpg "A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/germany-france-step-up-security-at-jewish-sites-amid-israel-war/)

Illustrative: A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)

Germany and France move to reinforce security around Jewish temples, schools and monuments after the surprise attack by Hamas against Israel.

Germany tightens police protection of Jewish and Israeli institutions, as some supporters of the Palestinians took to the streets of Berlin to celebrate the attack.

France is focusing on Jewish temples and schools in cities across the country, as one Jewish leader expresses concern at the possibility the conflict might be imported there.

‚ÄúIn Berlin, police protection has been immediately stepped up,‚Äù Germany‚Äôs Interior Minister Nancy Faeser tells Bild newspaper. ‚ÄúThe federal government and the regions are closely coordinating their actions.‚Äù

Germany‚Äôs authorities are also closely watching ‚Äúpotential supporters of Hamas in the Islamist sphere,‚Äù she adds.

In France, security had already been stepped up at synagogues in Paris, Marseille, Lyon and Strasbourg because of the holiday period being observed since late September.

Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin sends an urgent message to prefects running the country‚Äôs regions asking them to reinforce surveillance even further.

‚ÄúAt a time when terrorist attacks from Gaza are hitting Israel, I ask you to immediately step up vigilance, security and protection of Jewish community sites in France,‚Äù he writes in a message seen by AFP.

He called for a ‚Äúvisible and systematic static presence,‚Äù and the use of soldiers from France‚Äôs Operation Sentinelle, a special force deployed across the country since the 2015 terror attacks. The interior ministry will review the security situation at a special meeting tomorrow.

[11:46 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/border-town-identifies-at-least-15-of-its-residents-killed-in-hamas-attack/)

#### [Border town identifies at least 15 of its residents killed in Hamas attack](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/border-town-identifies-at-least-15-of-its-residents-killed-in-hamas-attack/)

The Gaza border town of Netiv HaAsara publishes the names of 15 residents who have been killed in today‚Äôs attack by Hamas terrorists.

The names of those killed are listed as:

Amit Wax  
Yigael Wax  
Adi Baharav  
Tal Keren  
Oren Stern  
Ruti Akuni  
Aryeh Akuni  
Or Akuni  
Orit Molcho  
Shlomi Molcho  
Nurit Berger  
Hevik Segel  
Marina Almagor  
Gil Ta‚Äôaseh  
Dani Wabak

A statement from the town notes that these are the names that ‚Äúhave been cleared for publication.‚Äù The town has a population of around 900.

[11:44 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-official-our-attack-has-only-just-begun/)

#### [Hamas official: Our attack has only just begun](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-official-our-attack-has-only-just-begun/)

By [Gianluca Pacchiani](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gianluca-pacchiani/ "Gianluca Pacchiani")

Hussam Badran, a member of the political bureau of Hamas, says the terror group‚Äôs onslaught is only in its early stages.

Badran says the attack, called the ‚ÄúAl-Aqsa Deluge‚Äù by the terror group, comes after careful preparation aimed at catching Israel by surprise.

The terror leader says this battle is different from all previous rounds of conflict, and calls on Arab mediators to convey to Israel that it must ‚Äúleave our occupied lands.‚Äù

He adds that Hamas does not expect them to be mediators but rather supporters of its position.

Like a number of Hamas leaders who have issued statements today, Badran claims the attack is motivated by Israeli control over the flashpoint Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem.

The mosque, the third holiest site for Muslims, sits atop the Temple Mount, the holiest site for Jews as the location of the biblical temples. Israel has long maintained a delicate status quo at the site, in which Jews are allowed to visit during limited hours, but not pray. Terror groups have repeatedly used baseless claims of Israeli intentions to take over the mosque as a pretext for violence.

Badran also blames Israeli policies in the West Bank and its treatment of Palestinian prisoners for the attack, adding that ‚Äúwe are the owners of this land, and this occupation will not last forever.‚Äù

The surprise onslaught against Israel has killed at least 250 Israelis, including many civilians, and injured over 1,000. An unspecified number of Israelis, living and dead, are held hostage by terrorists in Gaza.

[11:41 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/ireland-condemns-hamas-attack-stresses-need-for-moderate-voices/)

#### [Ireland condemns Hamas attack, stresses need for ‚Äòmoderate voices‚Äô](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/ireland-condemns-hamas-attack-stresses-need-for-moderate-voices/)

By [AFP](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/afp/ "AFP")

Irish deputy premier and foreign affairs minister Micheal Martin condemns the attack by Hamas on Israeli citizens, and says it is ‚Äúvital that the voice of moderation comes to the fore.‚Äù

Martin says he could ‚Äúsee tensions rising‚Äù during a recent trip to the region, and that the scale of today‚Äôs attack is ‚Äúquite shocking.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe believe a two-state solution remains the only sensible and rational solution to this issue and it needs political momentum behind it,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúMy sense is that the hardliners are growing in influence, and that‚Äôs why I believe the need to have moderate voices in the center is key,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúSo what we need really is a political peace process to get on track in a serious way. That will mean I think, international intervention as well to facilitate that, but it‚Äôs a very, very complex and difficult situation and there will be many consequences to today‚Äôs attack.‚Äù

[11:38 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/courts-system-to-operate-on-emergency-mode-tomorrow-amid-war/)

#### [Courts system to operate on emergency mode tomorrow amid war](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/courts-system-to-operate-on-emergency-mode-tomorrow-amid-war/)

By [Jeremy Sharon](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/jeremy-sharon/ "Jeremy Sharon")

[![An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. (Chaim Goldberg/FLASH90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/09/F230801CG05-e1694469761890-640x400.jpg "An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. (Chaim Goldberg/FLASH90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/courts-system-to-operate-on-emergency-mode-tomorrow-amid-war/)

An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. (Chaim Goldberg/FLASH90)

Israel‚Äôs courts will operate on an emergency footing tomorrow and will only hold hearings on urgent matters due to the Hamas invasion of southern Israel and the war with Gaza, it announces.

A statement put out by the Israel Courts Administration says the decision was made by Justice Minister Yariv Levin ‚Äúwith the knowledge of and \[in accordance with the\] opinion of Supreme Court President Justice Esther Hayut and Director of the Courts Administration Judge Michael Spitzer.‚Äù

The decision applies to Israel‚Äôs magistrates, district and labor courts, as well as the Supreme Court and the rabbinical courts.

Hearings scheduled for parole committees on Sunday will be postponed to a later date.

[11:29 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/commander-of-idf-nahal-brigade-killed-during-clashes-with-hamas-idf-says/)

#### [Commander of IDF Nahal Brigade killed during clashes with Hamas, IDF says](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/commander-of-idf-nahal-brigade-killed-during-clashes-with-hamas-idf-says/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![Col. Jonathan Steinberg, the commander of the Nahal Brigade, in an undated photo (Israel Defense Forces)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/WhatsApp_Image_2023-10-07_at_22.38.48_1-640x400.jpeg "Col. Jonathan Steinberg, the commander of the Nahal Brigade, in an undated photo (Israel Defense Forces)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/commander-of-idf-nahal-brigade-killed-during-clashes-with-hamas-idf-says/)

Col. Jonathan Steinberg, the commander of the Nahal Brigade, in an undated photo (Israel Defense Forces)

The commanding officer of the Nahal Infantry Brigade, Col. Jonathan¬†Steinberg, was killed this morning during clashes with Hamas terrorists in the Kerem Shalom area near the border with the Gaza Strip, the military says.

Steinberg, 42, from the southern town of Shomria, was en route to the site of clashes being managed by his subordinates when he encountered a terrorist who killed him.

He is one of the most senior Israeli officers to have been killed in combat in recent memory.

[11:18 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/us-muslim-umbrella-org-issues-statement-backing-palestinians-no-mention-of-hamas-attacks/)

#### [US Muslim umbrella org issues statement backing Palestinians, no mention of Hamas attacks](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/us-muslim-umbrella-org-issues-statement-backing-palestinians-no-mention-of-hamas-attacks/)

The United States Council of Muslim Organizations (USCMO), a Muslim umbrella organization in the US, issues a statement reiterating its support for Palestinians, and does not mention or condemn in any way the Hamas attacks on Israeli civilians.

The statement condemns ‚Äúthe recent unprovoked and continuous attacks by Israel on Palestinian towns, cities, and refugee camps‚Äù as well as ‚Äúthe inhumane siege imposed on the nearly 2 million inhabitants of Gaza,‚Äù which the organization says is ‚Äúan implied declaration of open war on the Palestinians which oblige them to be in constant self-defense.‚Äù

The organization calls on the US government ‚Äúto exert pressure on the occupation regime to immediately cease these atrocities‚Äù and criticizes any Arab and Muslim nations that have normalized relations with Israel.

[11:01 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/blinken-calls-on-abbas-to-condemn-hamas-attack-on-israel/)

#### [Blinken calls on Abbas to condemn Hamas attack on Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/blinken-calls-on-abbas-to-condemn-hamas-attack-on-israel/)

[![Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas (R) and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken shake hands following their meeting in the West Bank city of Ramallah on January 31, 2023. Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas (R) and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken shake hands following their meeting in the West Bank city of Ramallah on January 31, 2023. (Ronaldo Schemidt/Pool/AFP)

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken says he has spoken with Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas and is urging him to take steps toward calming the situation.

According to the US State Department, Blinken calls ‚Äúon all leadership in the region to condemn‚Äù the Hamas attacks on Israel, and also urges the PA to ‚Äúenhance steps to restore calm and stability in the West Bank.‚Äù

Today in Ramallah, Abbas chaired an emergency leadership meeting of the Palestinian Authority, and according to the official news agency Wafa, ‚Äúgave instructions to provide protection for the Palestinian people, stressing the right of the Palestinian people to defend themselves against the terrorism of settlers and the occupation forces.‚Äù

Abbas also ‚Äúgave directions to provide all that is necessary to bolster the resilience and steadfastness of the Palestinian people in facing the crimes committed by the Israeli occupation and settler gangs.‚Äù

[10:49 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/barrage-of-rockets-fired-toward-southern-israel/)

[10:48 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-thanks-biden-for-unreserved-support-says-israel-faces-challenging-days-but-will-win/)

#### [Netanyahu thanks Biden for unreserved support, says Israel faces ‚Äòchallenging days‚Äô but will win](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-thanks-biden-for-unreserved-support-says-israel-faces-challenging-days-but-will-win/)

Netanyahu says the army is currently clearing Hamas terrorists from everywhere they infiltrated, going house to house, ‚Äúrestoring control to our hands.‚Äù

He sends love and condolences to all the bereaved families that lost loved ones ‚Äúbrutally murdered in cold blood.‚Äù He prays for the recovery of the injured.

And he warns Hamas that Israel will hold it responsible for the hostages it has taken. ‚ÄúIsrael will avenge anyone who is harmed,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúin so much as a hair on their head.‚Äù

He says Israel stands in solidarity with residents of the south, who stood firm and fought bravely.

He praises the security forces, calling them the latest in the long history of Israel‚Äôs war heroes.

‚ÄúYou are fighting now for all of our homes, for all of our futures,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúWe are all with you, we all love you, we all salute you.‚Äù

He praises the members of the emergency services, and says their spirit will help overcome our enemies.

He says he spoke with President Biden and other world leaders from France, Britain and beyond, thanks Biden for his ‚Äúunreserved support,‚Äù and says he secured international backing for ‚Äúfreedom of action‚Äù for Israel.

Netanyahu says all Israelis ‚Äúare in this together. It will take time. It will be hard. We have challenging days ahead of us.‚Äù

But he promises that ‚Äúwith God‚Äôs help, with our combined strength, and with our belief in an eternal Israel, we will win.‚Äù

[10:44 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/major-airlines-cancel-dozens-of-flights-to-tel-aviv-amid-war/)

#### [Major airlines cancel dozens of flights to Tel Aviv amid war](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/major-airlines-cancel-dozens-of-flights-to-tel-aviv-amid-war/)

By [AFP](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/afp/ "AFP")

[![Airplanes at Ben Gurion International Airport, on May 7, 2021. (Yossi Aloni/FLASH90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2021/05/F210508YA04-1-640x400.jpg "Airplanes at Ben Gurion International Airport, on May 7, 2021. (Yossi Aloni/FLASH90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/major-airlines-cancel-dozens-of-flights-to-tel-aviv-amid-war/)

Airplanes at Ben Gurion International Airport, on May 7, 2021. (Yossi Aloni/FLASH90)

Major airlines have canceled dozens of flights to Tel Aviv after Hamas launches a surprise large-scale attack against Israel.

American Airlines, Air France, Lufthansa, Emirates, Ryanair and Aegan Airlines are among those pulling flights.

Air France says it has halted Tel Aviv flights ‚Äúuntil further notice.‚Äù

Air France-KLM group‚Äôs low-cost carrier Transavia also canceled a flight from Paris to Tel Aviv this evening.

In Warsaw, Polish carrier LOT says it has also canceled a flight to Tel Aviv today.

[10:36 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/report-israelis-still-held-hostage-inside-kibbutz-dining-hall/)

#### [Report: Israelis still held hostage inside kibbutz dining hall](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/report-israelis-still-held-hostage-inside-kibbutz-dining-hall/)

[![Israeli soldiers head south near Ashkelon, October 7, 2023. Israeli soldiers head south near Ashkelon, October 7, 2023. (AP Photo/Ohad Zwigenberg)

Security forces are still trying to extricate an undisclosed number of Israelis who have been held hostage for hours by Hamas gunmen inside the dining hall at Kibbutz Be‚Äôeri.

Large numbers of security forces are deployed in the area, Channel 12 reports.

[10:36 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-we-will-target-hamas-everywhere-it-operates-gazans-should-get-out-now/)

#### [Netanyahu: We will target Hamas everywhere it operates; Gazans should ‚Äòget out now‚Äô](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-we-will-target-hamas-everywhere-it-operates-gazans-should-get-out-now/)

[![Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivers a televised address on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/ GPO)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/bibimad-640x400.jpg "Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivers a televised address on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/ GPO)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-we-will-target-hamas-everywhere-it-operates-gazans-should-get-out-now/)

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivers a televised address on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/ GPO)

In an address to the nation, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vows to use ‚Äúall the power‚Äù of the IDF to destroy Hamas‚Äôs capabilities, and tells Gaza‚Äôs residents to ‚Äúget out now.‚Äù

Calling today‚Äôs events something ‚Äúnever before seen in Israel,‚Äù he vows to ensure ‚Äúit will never happen again.‚Äù

He begins by saying Hamas ‚Äúinvaded Israeli territory this morning,‚Äù and started a ‚Äúcruel and evil war,‚Äù targeting innocent civilians young and old.

‚ÄúWe will win this war, but the price will be unbearably heavy,‚Äù he says.

‚ÄúHamas wants to murder us all,‚Äù Netanyahu says, ‚Äúmurdering children and mothers in their homes, in their beds.

‚ÄúIt is an enemy that kidnaps elderly people, children, young girls,‚Äù an enemy ‚Äúthat massacres and slaughters our civilians, our children, who simply wanted to enjoy the festival.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat happened today has never been seen before in Israel and I will ensure it never happens again. The entire government supports this decision. The IDF will immediately use all its power to destroy Hamas‚Äôs capabilities,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúWe will fight them to the bitter end and avenge this black day they plotted for Israel and its people.‚Äù

Israel will target Hamas everywhere ‚Äî turning the places it ‚Äúhides and operates‚Äù into ‚Äúcities of ruin.‚Äù

He tells the ‚Äúresidents of Gaza‚Äù to ‚Äúget out now because we will operate everywhere and with full force.‚Äù

[10:31 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/new-york-police-step-up-protection-of-jewish-communities/)

#### [New York police step up protection of Jewish communities](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/new-york-police-step-up-protection-of-jewish-communities/)

By [Luke Tress](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/luke-tress/ "Luke Tress")

New York State and New York City police have stepped up their protection of Jewish communities and synagogues, Governor Kathy Hochul says.

There are no known threats to New York Jews, she says, adding that local authorities are in touch with the FBI and other federal partners after the terror onslaught in Gaza.

Jewish security organizers have also said there are no known threats to US Jews, but are urging vigilance.

[10:28 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-from-multi-front-hamas-attack-rises-to-more-than-250/)

#### [Israeli death toll from multi-front Hamas attack rises to more than 250](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-from-multi-front-hamas-attack-rises-to-more-than-250/)

[![Bodies lie on a main road near Kibbutz Gevim on October 7, 2023 following an attack by Hamas terrorists. (Oren ZIV / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XK3W7-highres-1-640x400.jpg "Bodies lie on a main road near Kibbutz Gevim on October 7, 2023 following an attack by Hamas terrorists. Bodies lie on a main road near Kibbutz Gevim on October 7, 2023 following an attack by Hamas terrorists. (Oren ZIV / AFP)

The death toll from the Hamas terror group‚Äôs massive attack on Israel rises to more than 250, Hebrew-language media reports say, citing medical officials.

The toll is expected to continue to rise.

At least 1,450 have been wounded, many seriously.

Dozens of civilians as well as IDF soldiers are believed to have been abducted and brought into Gaza; the IDF has confirmed that soldiers and civilians have been taken hostage, but has not specified a number.

Thousands of rockets have been fired at the south and center of the country, killing a number of people.

[10:22 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/police-to-families-of-missing-bring-dna-samples-to-police-stations-to-aid-in-identification/)

#### [Police to families of missing: Bring DNA samples to police stations to aid in identification](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/police-to-families-of-missing-bring-dna-samples-to-police-stations-to-aid-in-identification/)

[![Bodies of slain Israeli civilians in the southern city of Sderot on October 7, 2023 following an attack by Hamas terrorists.
