PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand‚Äôs new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:60> This image shows Israelis fleeing the airport after the Houthis attack on July 19, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:60>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:60>

## Elaboration
The provided evidence does not contain any information about the image. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.


## Actions
```
web_search("Houthis attack Israel airport July 19 2024")
web_search("Israel airport crowded July 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On July 19, 2024, a drone attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, was claimed by the Houthis, resulting in one death and multiple injuries (<image:i>). The attack occurred hours after the Israeli military confirmed the killing of a senior Hezbollah commander. The attack on Tel Aviv was followed by an Israeli attack on Yemen on July 20, 2024, targeting Al Hudaydah, Yemen.

The Reuters article ([https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/)) and Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/drone-attack-on-israels-tel-aviv-leaves-one-dead-at-least-10-injured](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/drone-attack-on-israels-tel-aviv-leaves-one-dead-at-least-10-injured)) reported on the drone attack. Wikipedia ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/20_July_2024_Israeli_attack_on_Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/20_July_2024_Israeli_attack_on_Yemen)) discusses both the drone attack and the subsequent Israeli attack on Yemen.


### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources discuss Ben Gurion International Airport in Israel. One article from Haaretz, published on July 4, 2024, discusses the expected increase in passenger numbers at the airport during the summer, although still lower than pre-war levels. Another article, dated July 2025, discusses the recovery of tourism in Israel, mentioning typical crowds and queues at the airport. The Times of Israel published an article on August 4, 2024, about Ben Gurion Airport, mentioning that more than 18 airlines have canceled or suspended flights. The article includes images of the arrivals and departures halls at Ben Gurion Airport on August 4, 2024. <image:4795>, <image:4797>, <image:4798>, <image:4800>.

The first article can be found here: [Source](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2024-07-04/ty-article/.premium/ben-gurion-airport-expects-summer-surge-in-passengers-still-below-pre-war-levels/00000190-7d33-d835-a9fb-ffbb2c030000). The second article can be found here: [Source](https://airfasttrack.com/is-there-any-tourism-in-israel-now-july-2025/). The third article can be found here: [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/amid-war-fears-at-ben-gurion-airport-its-business-as-usual-just-less-of-it/).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms a drone attack on Tel Aviv on July 19, 2024, claimed by the Houthis. The web search results also mention Ben Gurion Airport. However, the provided images from the Times of Israel, dated August 4, 2024, show a different scene than the one in the claim. Therefore, I cannot confirm the claim.



# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
image_search("Israel airport crowded July 19 2024")
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

Content: NONE

The Times of Israel also published an article about travel chaos at Ben Gurion Airport, including an image of a crowded airport (<image:4820>).

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:60> This image shows Israelis fleeing the airport after the Houthis attack on July 19, 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:60>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:60>

## Elaboration
The provided evidence does not contain any information about the image. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.


## Actions
```

web_search("Israel airport crowded July 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`

The attack occurred hours after the Israeli military confirmed the killing of a senior Hezbollah commander. The attack on Tel Aviv was followed by an Israeli attack on Yemen on July 20, 2024, targeting Al Hudaydah, Yemen.

The Reuters article ([https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/)) and Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/drone-attack-on-israels-tel-aviv-leaves-one-dead-at-least-10-injured](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/drone-attack-on-israels-tel-aviv-leaves-one-dead-at-least-10-injured)) reported on the drone attack. Wikipedia ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/20_July_2024_Israeli_attack_on_Yemen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/20_July_2024_Israeli_attack_on_Yemen)) discusses both the drone attack and the subsequent Israeli attack on Yemen.


### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources discuss Ben Gurion International Airport in Israel. One article from Haaretz, published on July 4, 2024, discusses the expected increase in passenger numbers at the airport during the summer, although still lower than pre-war levels. Another article, dated July 2025, discusses the recovery of tourism in Israel, mentioning typical crowds and queues at the airport. The Times of Israel published an article on August 4, 2024, about Ben Gurion Airport, mentioning that more than 18 airlines have canceled or suspended flights. The article includes images of the arrivals and departures halls at Ben Gurion Airport on August 4, 2024. <image:4795>, <image:4797>, <image:4798>, <image:4800>.

The first article can be found here: [Source](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2024-07-04/ty-article/.premium/ben-gurion-airport-expects-summer-surge-in-passengers-still-below-pre-war-levels/00000190-7d33-d835-a9fb-ffbb2c030000). The second article can be found here: [Source](https://airfasttrack.com/is-there-any-tourism-in-israel-now-july-2025/). The third article can be found here: [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/amid-war-fears-at-ben-gurion-airport-its-business-as-usual-just-less-of-it/).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms a drone attack on Tel Aviv on July 19, 2024, claimed by the Houthis. The web search results also mention Ben Gurion Airport. However, the provided images from the Times of Israel, dated August 4, 2024, show a different scene than the one in the claim. Therefore, I cannot confirm the claim.



## Actions
```
image_search("Israel airport crowded July 19 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
The image search results show crowded airports. One article from Euronews, published on July 19, 2024, discusses flight delays and cancellations (<image:4819>). The Times of Israel also published an article about travel chaos at Ben Gurion Airport, including an image of a crowded airport (<image:4820>).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image search results show crowded airports, including Ben Gurion Airport. However, the provided images do not match the image in the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On July 19, 2024, a drone attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, was claimed by the Houthis, resulting in one death and multiple injuries (<image:i>). The attack occurred hours after the Israeli military confirmed the killing of a senior Hezbollah commander. The attack on Tel Aviv was followed by an Israeli attack on Yemen on July 20, 2024, targeting Al Hudaydah, Yemen.

The Reuters article ([https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/)) and Al Jazeera ([https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/drone-attack-on-israels-tel-aviv-leaves-one-dead-at-least-10-injured](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/drone-attack-on-israels-tel-aviv-leaves-one-dead-at-least-10-injured)) reported on the drone attack. Another article, dated July 2025, discusses the recovery of tourism in Israel, mentioning typical crowds and queues at the airport. The Times of Israel published an article on August 4, 2024, about Ben Gurion Airport, mentioning that more than 18 airlines have canceled or suspended flights. The third article can be found here: [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/amid-war-fears-at-ben-gurion-airport-its-business-as-usual-just-less-of-it/).

The Times of Israel also published an article about travel chaos at Ben Gurion Airport, including an image of a crowded airport (<image:4820>).

The image search results show crowded airports, including Ben Gurion Airport. However, the provided images do not match the image in the claim. Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.

The claim cannot be verified. While there was a drone attack on Tel Aviv on July 19, 2024, and the airport was crowded, the image provided in the claim has not been verified. The image search and web search results do not match the image in the claim. `false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources discuss Ben Gurion International Airport in Israel. One article from Haaretz, published on July 4, 2024, discusses the expected increase in passenger numbers at the airport during the summer, although still lower than pre-war levels. PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand‚Äôs new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

**, many celebrities are also choosing to weigh in with their thoughts.

**. [What to know on the fifth day of the latest Israel-Palestinian war](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/652680c6e2704e628f8b4598.html)
    
*   World News. He has shared a long statement on his Instagram account in which he expressed his heartbreak and outrage at the events of the past four days.

TV reporter bursts into tears while talking about the victims of the Israel-Hamas conflictRoberto Ortega

The Rock's statement on the Israel-Palestine conflict
-----------------------------------------------------

"I'm heartbroken, angry, and sickened by the brutal murders and kidnapping of Jewish people through the horrific acts of the Hamas terrorist group," he began.

"The growing loss of innocent Israeli and Palestinian lives is heart-wrenching as this war escalates to immense proportions.

"I don't pretend to know everything about the complex conflict in the Middle East. Why are Israel and Palestine at war?](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/08/6522d5e4268e3e011e8b4576.html?intcmp=MNOT23801&s_kw=3)

**Key Takeaways**

*   Dwayne Johnson has not been noted for direct engagements with Israel, such as visits or events, but has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict.
*   He has made public statements condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost in the conflict.
*   Johnson's overall stance on Israel is not explicitly supportive or critical, but he emphasizes compassion and peace.

Dwayne Johnson is a globally recognized figure, known for his career in both professional wrestling and Hollywood. The question of whether Dwayne Johnson supports Israel is complex, given his recent statements on the Israel-Palestine conflict. Does Dwayne Johnson Support Israel?

### Has Dwayne Johnson Engaged with Israel Directly?

Dwayne Johnson has not been reported to have engaged directly with Israel through visits or personal connections. His stance on Israel is not explicitly supportive or critical but emphasizes the importance of peace and compassion.

*   Johnson's overall political alignment is not strongly affiliated with any particular side in the Israel/Palestine conflict, as he tends to focus on broader humanitarian concerns.
*   Key points about his stance:
    *   He condemns terrorism and supports peace.
    *   Johnson does not explicitly support or criticize either side in the conflict.

### Community Engagement and Advocacy

Dwayne Johnson is known for his philanthropic efforts, but these have not specifically targeted Israel or Israeli organizations. His advocacy focuses more on general humanitarian causes.

*   Johnson has not undertaken any charitable or advocacy work specifically related to Israel.
*   His community engagement and advocacy efforts are generally aimed at broader social issues rather than specific national or political causes.

### Cultural Impact Related to Israel

Dwayne Johnson's influence on cultural perceptions of Israel is minimal, as his public persona and actions have not been directly associated with Israeli cultural initiatives or events.

*   Johnson's cultural contributions and endorsements have not specifically resonated in Israel or impacted local Israeli cultural initiatives.
*   His influence is more aligned with global entertainment and humanitarian efforts rather than specific cultural engagements with Israel.

### Conclusion: Dwayne Johnson‚Äôs Relationship with Israel

Dwayne Johnson's relationship with Israel is not characterized by direct engagement or explicit political support. His public life is more focused on his entertainment career and philanthropic efforts rather than political or cultural engagements with specific countries.

*   There are no documented instances of Dwayne Johnson visiting Israel or participating in events specifically related to Israeli culture or politics.
*   Johnson's professional and personal life has not included any notable collaborations or ties with Israeli communities or organizations.

### Has Dwayne Johnson Expressed Opinions on Israel?

Dwayne Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, emphasizing the need for peace and condemning acts of terrorism.

*   He has made public statements condemning the brutal acts of terrorism and expressing sympathy for the loss of innocent lives on both sides of the conflict.
*   Johnson has not participated in specific discussions or events focused solely on Israeli affairs but has used his platform to advocate for peace and compassion.

### What Is Dwayne Johnson‚Äôs Stance on Politics and Israel?

Dwayne Johnson's political perspective is generally neutral, focusing more on humanitarian issues than political alignments. Therefore, it can be concluded that while Johnson does not actively support or criticize Israel, his focus is on promoting peace and compassion in the conflict.

Hollywood stars are showing their support for Israel, after Hamas launched a surprise attack this past weekend, firing thousands of rockets from Gaza that have killed at least 900 people with more than 100 civilians kidnapped and held hostage.

The attack, which occurred early Saturday morning on Shabbat and coincided with the Jewish high holiday of Simchat Torah, is being called ‚ÄúIsrael‚Äôs 9/11‚Äù and is the deadliest day in Israel in 50 years. Gal Gadot,¬†Madonna, Dwayne ‚ÄúThe Rock‚Äù Johnson, Natalie Portman, Andy Cohen, Jamie Lee Curtis, Debra Messing,¬†Amy Schumer,¬†Sarah Silverman,¬†Kris Jenner, Mindy Kaling and Meghan McCain are among the celebrities who have taken to social media to stand alongside Israel.

Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds have donated $1 million to help children in Israel and Gaza, sources tell _Variety_.

‚ÄúI stand with Israel you should too,‚Äù [Gadot posted](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyHF5n1t322/)
. ‚ÄúThe growing loss of innocent Israeli and Palestinian lives is heart wrenching as this war escalates to immense proportions.‚Äù

> [A post shared by Dwayne Johnson (@therock)](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyPX7z8L-Sz/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

Madonna [posted a video](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyI29uYO0bh/?hl=en)
 on her Instagram showing footage of rockets and slain bodies on the streets of Israel. Nine American citizens are among the climbing death toll.

### Popular on Variety

Over the weekend, President Joe Biden condemned the terrorist attack and supported Israel‚Äôs right to defend itself. ‚ÄúThe United States unequivocally condemns this appalling assault against Israel by Hamas terrorists from Gaza, and I made clear to Prime Minister Netanyahu that we stand ready to offer all appropriate means of support to the Government and people of Israel. ‚ÄúMy Administration‚Äôs support for Israel‚Äôs security is rock solid and unwavering.‚Äù

Israel ordered a ‚Äúcomplete siege‚Äù of Gaza on Monday, cutting off all electricity, food and water to the area. More than 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israel airstrikes, in response to the Hamas attack.

Now, some of Hollywood‚Äôs biggest stars are speaking up to lend their support to Israel. What a horrific day.‚Äù

Selma Blair, who is Jewish, commented on social media to offer her unwavering support to Israel and Jews around the world. I stand with Israel.‚Äù

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyLj3NoRpu4/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)
> 
> [A post shared by NFL (@nfl)](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyLj3NoRpu4/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

Both the [NBA](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyLj3NoRpu4/)
 and [MLB](https://twitter.com/MLB/status/1711439508825157770?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet)

Former New York Knicks star Amar‚Äôe Stoudemire ‚Äî who converted to Judaism and is an Israeli-American citizen ‚Äî [posted a video on Instagram](https://twitter.com/TheDunkCentral/status/1711152518045008120?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1711152518045008120%7Ctwgr%5E4c100637d6e5161037d549d6c23fa66d3555bc1b%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fnypost.com%2F2023%2F10%2F09%2Famare-stoudemire-rips-politicians-blm-over-israel-silence%2F)
 to denounce those are staying silent amid Hamas‚Äô attacks on Jews.

‚ÄúI woke up, man, this morning with some disturbing news out of Israel ‚Äî that Hamas kidnapping children, putting them in cages, killing women, killing the elderly. I pray that all involved are able to find a resolution.‚Äù)

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyOZm4gpWRN/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)
> 
> [A post shared by UTA (@unitedtalent)](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyOZm4gpWRN/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

The major talent agencies in Hollywood ‚Äî UTA, CAA and WME ‚Äî have all taken public stances to stand with Israel and to support Jews.

WME said it will [match employee donations](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyO3Tcqy1nm/?hl=en&img_index=1)
 to organizations funding relief in Israel and Palestine.

The Royals have also lent their support to Israel.

Britain‚Äôs King Charles condemned the ‚Äúbarbaric acts of terrorism,‚Äù via a spokesperson from Buckingham Palace.

A spokesperson for Prince William and Kate Middleton commented: ‚ÄúThe Prince and Princess of Wales are profoundly distressed by the devastating events that have unfolded in the past days."

The article mentions Johnson's Instagram post but does not show him wearing the Israeli flag.


From [Source](https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X):

* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:64> This is an authentic image of Dwayne Johnson waring the Israeli flag in support of Israel."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:64>)
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
There is no new evidence to analyze the claim.


## Actions
```
web_search("Dwayne Johnson Israel support")
image_search("Dwayne Johnson Israeli flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost, as reported by [Marca.com](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html) and [Shop Israel](https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X). The sources do not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. <image:2699> <image:1> <image:2700>


### Evidence from `image_search`
Yahoo News published an article about a fake image of Dwayne Johnson ([https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/fact-check-fake-dwayne-johnson-234700368.html](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/fact-check-fake-dwayne-johnson-234700368.html)). Euronews published an article on November 14, 2023, about Dwayne Johnson ([https://www.euronews.com/culture/2023/11/14/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-says-political-parties-asked-him-to-run-for-president](https://www.euronews.com/culture/2023/11/14/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-says-political-parties-asked-him-to-run-for-president)).

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. The evidence indicates that the image is fake. Multiple sources confirm that the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is fabricated, and a quote associated with the image is also fabricated.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:64> This is an authentic image of Dwayne Johnson waring the Israeli flag in support of Israel."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:64>)
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
There is no new evidence to analyze the claim.


## Actions
```
web_search("Dwayne Johnson Israel support")
image_search("Dwayne Johnson Israeli flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost, as reported by [Marca.com](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html) and [Shop Israel](https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X). Variety also reported that Johnson, along with other Hollywood stars, has shown support for Israel amid the Hamas attacks ([Variety](https://variety.com/2023/film/news/hollywood-stars-support-israel-palestine-conflict-1235749537/)). The sources do not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. <image:2699> <image:1> <image:2700>


### Evidence from `image_search`
Yahoo News published an article about a fake image of Dwayne Johnson ([https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/fact-check-fake-dwayne-johnson-234700368.html](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/fact-check-fake-dwayne-johnson-234700368.html)). Euronews published an article on November 14, 2023, about Dwayne Johnson ([https://www.euronews.com/culture/2023/11/14/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-says-political-parties-asked-him-to-run-for-president](https://www.euronews.com/culture/2023/11/14/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-says-political-parties-asked-him-to-run-for-president)).

Myth Detector states that the quote is fabricated ([https://mythdetector.com/en/dwayne-johnson-about-israel/](https://mythdetector.com/en/dwayne-johnson-about-israel/)). <image:4831> <image:4832> <image:4833>


## Elaboration
The claim is false. The evidence indicates that the image is fake. Multiple sources confirm that the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is fabricated, and a quote associated with the image is also fabricated.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is fabricated. While he has expressed views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, the specific image and associated quote are not authentic.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:64> This is an authentic image of Dwayne Johnson waring the Israeli flag in support of Israel."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:64>)
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
There is no new evidence to analyze the claim.


## Actions
```
web_search("Dwayne Johnson Israel support")
image_search("Dwayne Johnson Israeli flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost, as reported by [Marca.com](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html) and [Shop Israel](https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X). Variety also reported that Johnson, along with other Hollywood stars, has shown support for Israel amid the Hamas attacks ([Variety](https://variety.com/2023/film/news/hollywood-stars-support-israel-palestine-conflict-1235749537/)). The sources do not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. <image:2699> <image:1> <image:2700>


### Evidence from `image_search`
Yahoo News published an article about a fake image of Dwayne Johnson ([https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/fact-check-fake-dwayne-johnson-234700368.html](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/fact-check-fake-dwayne-johnson-234700368.html)). Euronews published an article on November 14, 2023, about Dwayne Johnson ([https://www.euronews.com/culture/2023/11/14/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-says-political-parties-asked-him-to-run-for-president](https://www.euronews.com/culture/2023/11/14/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-says-political-parties-asked-him-to-run-for-president)).

## Elaboration
The claim is false. The evidence indicates that the image is fake. Multiple sources confirm that the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is fabricated, and a quote associated with the image is also fabricated.


## Final Judgement
The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is fabricated. While he has expressed views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, the specific image and associated quote are not authentic.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is fabricated, as confirmed by multiple sources, including [Yahoo News](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/fact-check-fake-dwayne-johnson-234700368.html) and [Myth Detector](https://mythdetector.com/en/dwayne-johnson-about-israel/).

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand‚Äôs new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:65> This is an authentic image of an elderly Palestinian women being attacked by an Israeli army dog in June 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:65>)
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

Israeli Police Dog Attack on Elderly Palestinian Woman Sparks Outrage
=====================================================================

A disturbing leaked video came to light on Tuesday showing an Israeli police dog brutally attacking an elderly Palestinian woman inside her home during their raid of the Jabalia refugee camp several weeks ago.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

!Sara Zouiten <image:2735>by[Sara Zouiten](https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/author/sara-zouiten/)

[Jun, 26, 2024](https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/2024/06/18005/israeli-police-dog-attack-on-elderly-palestinian-woman-sparks-outrage/)

 <image:2738>

Rabat ‚Äì A disturbing leaked video came to light on Tuesday showing an Israeli police dog brutally attacking an elderly Palestinian woman inside her home during their raid of the Jabalia refugee camp several weeks ago.

The **[footage](https://www.instagram.com/p/C8rTeL6pF3M/?igsh=MWRhbzlyYm00Zjl4Ng==)
**, which was obtained by Al Jazeera, has sparked social media fury and widespread condemnation. Captured from a camera mounted on the dog, the video showed the 66-year-old woman screaming in terror as she was viciously attacked.

The elderly woman, identified as Dawlat Al Tanani, suffered severe injuries and fractures as a result of the brutal attack.

Speaking to Al Jazeera, she said that Israeli Occupation Forces (IOF) unleashed the dog on her because she was resisting eviction from her home.

‚ÄúI refuse to be forced out of my house, nor will I abandon my home. So the Israelis set a dog on me, which bit me while I was sleeping in my bed. It dragged me and pulled me all the way to the entrance door,‚Äù the elderly woman said.

‚ÄúNow I have a serious injury. There are no hospitals or anything to treat my injury. My hand is still untreated,‚Äù she added.

The incident has reinforced accusations against the IOF of perpetrating severe forms of torture and violence against civilians, contrasting sharply with its self-proclaimed status as ‚Äúthe most moral army in the world.‚Äù

Social media users have widely shared the video, expressing shock for the extent the IOF goes to inflict pain and suffering on Palestinians.

Many activists have pointed out that such actions, including the use of police dogs against civilians, have been a longstanding practice by the Israeli forces.

‚ÄúIsrael/Zionist Occupiers brutality clearly has no limits‚Ä¶training dogs to rape and attack Palestinians. The daily massacres (are) getting (more) gruesome by the day,‚Äù **[said](https://x.com/huda54112445811/status/1805989054044938370)

* advertisements

* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

Hamas abducts IDF dog, Al Jazeera posts photos of it attacking old woman
========================================================================

IDF says the alleged attack occurs when terrorists had the dog and the camera attached to it. terrorists later kill the canine and rig his body with explosives to detonate on soldiers if they attempt to retrieve it
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Einav Halabi](https://www.ynetnews.com/topics/Einav_Halabi "Einav Halabi")
, [Yoav Zitun](https://www.ynetnews.com/topics/Yoav_Zitun "Yoav Zitun")
|

Related Topics

[Jabaliya](https://www.ynetnews.com/topics/Jabaliya "Jabaliya")

[Hamas](https://www.ynetnews.com/topics/Hamas "Hamas")

[Oketz](https://www.ynetnews.com/topics/Oketz "Oketz")

The IDF on Thursday refuted accusations that one of its canines attacked an old woman in Gaza. Qatar-based Al Jazeera published menacing photos showing the dog in an aggressive attack of the seemingly terrified resident of Jabaliya.

The military said one of its dogs was abducted by terrorists during the fighting in Gaza and was in their custody when the alleged attack occurred. It was later found killed and his body boobytrapped to explode on soldiers if they attempted to retrieve it.

4 View gallery

![◊õ◊ú◊ë ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊©◊†◊ó◊ò◊£ ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊û◊ó◊ë◊ú◊ô ◊ó◊û◊ê◊° ◊ë◊ß◊û◊§◊ô◊ô◊ü ◊™◊ß◊ô◊§◊™ ◊ê◊ô◊©◊î ◊ë◊í'◊ë◊ê◊ú◊ô◊î ◊©◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2024/06/27/HkFvk00qLR/HkFvk00qLR_0_0_716_701_0_x-large.jpg "IDF dog kidnapped and filmed attacking women in Jabaliya (AI-generated image)  ")![◊õ◊ú◊ë ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊©◊†◊ó◊ò◊£ ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊û◊ó◊ë◊ú◊ô ◊ó◊û◊ê◊° ◊ë◊ß◊û◊§◊ô◊ô◊ü ◊™◊ß◊ô◊§◊™ ◊ê◊ô◊©◊î ◊ë◊í'◊ë◊ê◊ú◊ô◊î ◊©◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2024/06/27/HkFvk00qLR/HkFvk00qLR_0_0_716_701_0_x-large.jpg "IDF dog kidnapped and filmed attacking women in Jabaliya (AI-generated image)  ")

IDF dog kidnapped and filmed attacking women in Jabaliya (AI-generated image)

A Paratrooper Division in search of terrorists sent the attack dog with its handler into a building where they were thought to be hiding. The dog did not return, nor were there sounds of struggle or explosions, the military told ynet. The troops set out to inspect the building remotely using drones. At first, the dog was nowhere to be found but it was later seen sprawled on the street.

The team managed to identify residual explosives coming from the dog's body. The explosives were removed from the dog, which was taken for burial in the canine cemetery in the Canine unit - Oketz base.

4 View gallery

![◊õ◊ú◊ë ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊©◊†◊ó◊ò◊£ ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊û◊ó◊ë◊ú◊ô ◊ó◊û◊ê◊° ◊ë◊ß◊û◊§◊ô◊ô◊ü ◊™◊ß◊ô◊§◊™ ◊ê◊ô◊©◊î ◊ë◊í'◊ë◊ê◊ú◊ô◊î ◊©◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2024/06/27/ByQK7O5IR/ByQK7O5IR_0_0_960_690_0_x-large.jpg "Little Red Riding Hood and the Wolf - Hamas version (AI-generated image)  ")![◊õ◊ú◊ë ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊©◊†◊ó◊ò◊£ ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊û◊ó◊ë◊ú◊ô ◊ó◊û◊ê◊° ◊ë◊ß◊û◊§◊ô◊ô◊ü ◊™◊ß◊ô◊§◊™ ◊ê◊ô◊©◊î ◊ë◊í'◊ë◊ê◊ú◊ô◊î ◊©◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2024/06/27/ByQK7O5IR/ByQK7O5IR_0_0_960_690_0_x-large.jpg "Little Red Riding Hood and the Wolf - Hamas version (AI-generated image)  ")

Little Red Riding Hood and the Wolf - Hamas version (AI-generated image)

The footage published by Al-Jazeera includes segments from the camera installed on the dog, showing it attacking the elderly woman in her home. She appears to be struggling with the dog on her bed.

However, the IDF said that even though the dog shown in the video was indeed a member of the canine unit, it had been abducted by Hamas with its equipment.

"The incident occurred after the handler lost touch with his dog," the IDF said. "It never received orders to harm civilians." The military added that killing the dog and rigging its body was part of Hamas' cynical tactics.

4 View gallery

![◊™◊ô◊¢◊ï◊ì ◊û◊§◊¢◊ô◊ú◊ï◊™ ◊ô◊ó◊ô◊ì◊™ ◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2023/12/31/ryGPW00eyd6/ryGPW00eyd6_0_0_1280_720_0_x-large.jpg "IDF denies ordering dog to attack woman  (Photo: IDF Spokesperson's Unit) ")![◊™◊ô◊¢◊ï◊ì ◊û◊§◊¢◊ô◊ú◊ï◊™ ◊ô◊ó◊ô◊ì◊™ ◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2023/12/31/ryGPW00eyd6/ryGPW00eyd6_0_0_1280_720_0_x-large.jpg "IDF denies ordering dog to attack woman  (Photo: IDF Spokesperson's Unit) ")

IDF denies ordering dog to attack woman

(Photo: IDF Spokesperson's Unit)

After the video went viral on social media, the woman, Daulat Abdallah Altanana, was compared to Little Red Riding Hood and the dog to the wolf. "He dragged me from the bedroom to the door and I was injured in my hand," said the woman who also claimed to have been displaced from her home during the war.

![◊õ◊ú◊ë ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊©◊†◊ó◊ò◊£ ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊û◊ó◊ë◊ú◊ô ◊ó◊û◊ê◊° ◊ë◊ß◊û◊§◊ô◊ô◊ü ◊™◊ß◊ô◊§◊™ ◊ê◊ô◊©◊î ◊ë◊í'◊ë◊ê◊ú◊ô◊î ◊©◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2024/06/27/HyIDJdcLC/HyIDJdcLC_0_258_590_332_0_x-large.jpg "Anas Al Sharif with the elderly woman who was attacked  ")![◊õ◊ú◊ë ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ß◊• ◊©◊†◊ó◊ò◊£ ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊û◊ó◊ë◊ú◊ô ◊ó◊û◊ê◊° ◊ë◊ß◊û◊§◊ô◊ô◊ü ◊™◊ß◊ô◊§◊™ ◊ê◊ô◊©◊î ◊ë◊í'◊ë◊ê◊ú◊ô◊î ◊©◊ë◊®◊¶◊ï◊¢◊™ ◊¢◊ñ◊î](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver5/crop_images/2024/06/27/HyIDJdcLC/HyIDJdcLC_0_258_590_332_0_x-large.jpg "Anas Al Sharif with the elderly woman who was attacked  ")

Anas Al Sharif with the elderly woman who was attacked

The footage was passed on to Al-Jazeera by correspondent Anas Al Sharif, who covers the northern Gaza area and is affiliated with Hamas. He is a resident of Jabaliya whose home was bombed in an IDF attack, and his father was killed. He is known to accompany Hamas terrorists and document their battles in Jabaliya.

Share

[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=http://www.alestiklal.net/en/article/how-does-israeli-occupation-employ-dogs-to-humiliate-and-oppress-palestinians)
[](https://x.com/intent/post?url=http://www.alestiklal.net/en/article/how-does-israeli-occupation-employ-dogs-to-humiliate-and-oppress-palestinians)
[](https://api.whatsapp.com/send?text=http://www.alestiklal.net/en/article/how-does-israeli-occupation-employ-dogs-to-humiliate-and-oppress-palestinians)
[](https://t.me/share/url?url=http://www.alestiklal.net/en/article/how-does-israeli-occupation-employ-dogs-to-humiliate-and-oppress-palestinians)
[](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=http://www.alestiklal.net/en/article/how-does-israeli-occupation-employ-dogs-to-humiliate-and-oppress-palestinians)

More than 100 dogs were deployed alongside Israeli forces during the aggression in Gaza that began in October 2023.

These dogs, part of the Oketz unit, have been lauded for their roles in military operations, with their stories often celebrated in Israeli media, just as stories of fallen or injured soldiers are shared.

But the celebration of these "warriors on four legs" glosses over the brutal reality of their involvement in the conflict.

Dogs from the Oketz unit played a key role in military raids, such as the attack on 70-year-old Dawlat al-Tanani in Jabalia camp, where one of the unit‚Äôs dogs savagely mauled her.

Another horrific incident occurred when a dog fatally attacked 24-year-old Mohammed Salah Bahar, a young man with Down syndrome, in his home in Gaza‚Äôs Shuja‚Äôiyya neighborhood.

History of Training
-------------------

The Oketz unit, known for its specialized training of attack dogs, has been increasingly deployed in operations against Palestinian civilians and prisoners.

Their role, however, has extended beyond Gaza. The dogs have reportedly been used in Israeli prisons, and there have been disturbing allegations of their involvement in torture.

A prisoner named Muhammad Arab, held in the Sde Teiman prison, reported that dogs were trained to assault detainees sexually, adding another layer of brutality to the treatment of prisoners under Israeli occupation.

The use of military dogs in this context is not new, but its intensification reflects a broader pattern of violence.

Since before the Nakba in 1948, dogs have played a role in the Zionist project‚Äôs colonial control over Palestinians.

The glorification of these "warriors on all fours" in Israeli media serves to mask their role in the ongoing suppression of Palestinians, a history that traces back decades and continues to evolve in the current conflict.

Throughout the 1950s and 1960s, military dogs were notably absent from the Israeli army's ranks, even as Jewish settlers brought new European breeds to Palestine in the wake of ‚ÄúIsrael‚Äôs‚Äù establishment.

In 1974, the Israeli Occupation discreetly revived its military dog unit, although it remained largely secret for more than a decade.

This renewed focus on dogs was closely tied to¬†the Israeli occupation of the West Bank and Gaza Strip, which began in 1967.

As Israeli forces faced growing resistance from Palestinian guerrilla fighters, the army saw a need for trained dogs to assist with intelligence and counterinsurgency missions.

Unit 7142, the newly reconstituted dog unit, played a key role in supporting Military Intelligence Unit 269, later known as Sayeret Matkal, one of the Israeli occupation's most elite special forces units.

Trained dogs were deployed to assist in countering what the Israeli occupation referred to as "terrorist activity," which in practice often meant confronting Palestinian guerrillas.

Despite its early successes, Israeli military leadership remained divided on the effectiveness of military dogs. Unit 7142 continued to operate under the radar, with doubts about the "colonial dog" and its utility in official army units lingering within the higher ranks.

!21israel-hamas-idfdogs-blpm-mediumSquareAt3X.jpg (1800√ó1800) <image:2743>

Weaponizing Dogs
----------------

Since the Israeli aggression on Gaza began on October 7, more than 100 dogs have played an integral role in Israeli operations in Gaza. Since the beginning of the war, dogs from this unit have worked alongside Israeli paratroopers and other forces.

According to a report by Yoav Zitun on the Ynet website, over 30 dogs from the unit have been killed, many due to explosives or gunfire.

Despite these losses, the unit‚Äôs size is expected to double in the coming years, as the army recognizes the tactical value of the dogs in Gaza.

The Oketz unit employs dogs equipped with advanced technology for both military operations and acts of retaliation.

On the battlefield, these dogs are trained to alert soldiers to potential dangers, such as explosives, and to scout sites like destroyed buildings or displaced homes.

One of their key roles is the detection of tunnels used by Palestinian resistance fighters. Equipped with cameras and eavesdropping devices, these dogs are often sent into tunnels ahead of human troops.

Sometimes, they even carry gas bombs that are triggered if the dog detects someone inside, turning the animal into a sacrificial tool.

Yet beyond these security functions, the dogs have also been deployed in brutal retaliatory actions.

The unit uses attack dogs‚Äîspecifically trained German Shepherds and Dobermanns‚Äîwhose role is to maul and kill humans.

There have been numerous reports of dogs attacking civilians, including graphic accounts of an elderly woman, Dawlat al-Tanani, in Jabalia camp, whose chest was torn apart by a military dog.

Testimonies from Gaza also describe how these dogs have been used as tools of psychological terror.

According to Fadi, a detainee released from the Sde Teiman camp, Israeli soldiers forced prisoners to endure sexual assaults by trained dogs.

Fadi‚Äôs testimony is one of many that highlight the level of dehumanization experienced by Palestinians during the war, with trained dogs playing a central role in this violence.

The story of a booby-trapped dog further underscores the grim interplay between human and canine sacrifice in this conflict.

This militarization of dogs in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict represents a deeper level of brutality, as these animals are used not only for tactical purposes but also as instruments of terror and revenge.![Israeli-reservists-pose-with-a-dog-they-brought-out-of-Gaza-in-December-2023.-Courtesy-of-Glass-Walls.jpg (1600√ó1000)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2024/01/Israeli-reservists-pose-with-a-dog-they-brought-out-of-Gaza-in-December-2023.-Courtesy-of-Glass-Walls.jpg)

Striking Violations
-------------------

Last week, the Israeli newspaper _Haaretz_ released disturbing footage from Megiddo Prison, revealing scenes of abuse against Palestinian prisoners.

In the leaked video, inmates in the prison‚Äôs security wing were shown lying on the ground, hands bound, as a guard walked over them with a dog, an apparent act of humiliation.

The use of dogs as a tool for abuse has been a longstanding concern for human rights groups.

In June, the Euro-Mediterranean Human Rights Monitor issued a report highlighting the Israeli military‚Äôs deployment of police dogs in the Gaza Strip.

According to the report, these dogs are used not only in military operations but also to terrorize prisoners, subjecting them to mauling and, in some instances, sexual violence.

The organization documented numerous cases of dog attacks on civilians during Israeli raids, particularly on homes, hospitals, and shelters.

In some operations, the dogs are equipped with surveillance cameras to scout locations ahead of Israeli soldiers.

Civilians are often left defenseless as the dogs are set upon them, with soldiers standing by or even encouraging the attacks. This behavior has drawn international condemnation.

Jeremy Laurence, a spokesperson for the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, has called such actions "serious violations" of ‚ÄúIsrael's legal obligations toward protected persons under the law of occupation.‚Äù

One particularly harrowing case involved Mohammed Bahar, a 24-year-old Palestinian man with Down syndrome.

During a military raid on Gaza‚Äôs Shuja‚Äôiyya neighborhood last July, a police dog attacked Bahar as he sat on a couch.

His mother recounted the brutal incident to Anadolu Agency, describing how the dog bit her son multiple times, causing fatal injuries.

In another incident from May, widely shared on social media, a police dog attacked 70-year-old Dawlat al-Tanani during an Israeli military operation in Jabalia camp, severely injuring her arm.

Euro-Mediterranean Human Rights Monitor has also documented the use of dogs in assaults on hospitals, including one attack in 2023 where dogs were unleashed on displaced civilians and even the bodies of the deceased. Another documented case occurred during an invasion of the Al-Shifa Medical Complex in March 2024.

The practice of using police dogs has not been limited to Gaza. In the West Bank, reports indicate a growing number of incidents in which dogs have been deployed during arrests and house raids, particularly against children.

WAFA, the Palestinian News Agency, has shared dozens of photos and videos showing soldiers setting dogs on civilians.

Human rights groups have labeled these attacks as a form of torture and degrading treatment, prohibited under international law.

Protests against this practice have spread beyond the region. On September 16, activists in the Netherlands demonstrated outside a K-9 training center in Oosterhout, demanding a halt to the export of police dogs to the Israeli military, which they claim are being used to target civilians.

The ongoing use of dogs in military operations has become a symbol of the broader human rights concerns surrounding Israel‚Äôs occupation, adding to the mounting calls for international accountability.

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The article from Al-Estiklal.net discusses the use of dogs by the Israeli occupation to humiliate and oppress Palestinians. The article includes the exact image provided in the claim <image:65>. The article mentions that more than 100 dogs were deployed alongside Israeli forces during the aggression in Gaza that began in October 2023. The article also mentions the Oketz unit and their role in military operations. The article also mentions the use of dogs in attacks on civilians. The article was published 10 months ago by Nuha Yousef.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:65> This is an authentic image of an elderly Palestinian women being attacked by an Israeli army dog in June 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:65>)
```

## Web Sources
**Reverse Search Result** The exact image was found in the following sources:

From [Source](https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/2024/06/18005/israeli-police-dog-attack-on-elderly-palestinian-woman-sparks-outrage/): Found exact image on website with title: Israeli Police Dog Attack on Elderly Palestinian Woman Sparks ...
Content: The article from Morocco World News, published on June 26, 2024, discusses a video showing an Israeli police dog attacking an elderly Palestinian woman. The incident occurred during a raid in the Jabalia refugee camp. The woman, Dawlat Al Tanani, sustained injuries and fractures. The article includes the image <image:65> and a link to the video footage. The article also mentions social media outrage and condemnation of the Israeli forces' actions. <image:2735> is the author of the article. The article also includes related posts from July 2025.


From [Source](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/ryura55lr): Found exact image on website with title: Hamas abducts IDF dog, Al Jazeera posts photos of it attacking old ...
Content: Ynetnews.com published an article about an image of a dog attacking an elderly woman. The IDF refuted accusations that one of its canines attacked an old woman in Gaza. The IDF said the dog was abducted by terrorists during the fighting in Gaza and was in their custody when the alleged attack occurred. The article includes the image in the claim <image:65> and states that the footage was passed on to Al-Jazeera by correspondent Anas Al Sharif, who covers the northern Gaza area and is affiliated with Hamas. The article also includes images <image:2740>, <image:2741>. The article was written by Einav Halabi and Yoav Zitun.


From [Source](https://www.alestiklal.net/en/article/how-does-israeli-occupation-employ-dogs-to-humiliate-and-oppress-palestinians): Found exact image on website with title: How Does Israeli Occupation Employ Dogs to Humiliate and ...
Content: The article from Al-Estiklal.net discusses the use of dogs by the Israeli occupation to humiliate and oppress Palestinians. The article includes the exact image provided in the claim <image:65>. The article mentions that more than 100 dogs were deployed alongside Israeli forces during the aggression in Gaza that began in October 2023. The article also mentions the Oketz unit and their role in military operations. The article also mentions the use of dogs in attacks on civilians. The article was published 10 months ago by Nuha Yousef.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

Israeli Soldier Unleashes Army Dog on 47-year-old Woman

[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.alhaq.org/monitoring-documentation/6941.html)
[](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Israeli Soldier Unleashes Army Dog on 47-year-old Woman&url=https://www.alhaq.org/monitoring-documentation/6941.html&original_referer=https://www.alhaq.org/monitoring-documentation/6941.html)
[](http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://www.alhaq.org/monitoring-documentation/6941.html&title=Israeli Soldier Unleashes Army Dog on 47-year-old Woman&source=alhaq.org)

\- 19-25 December - Ref.: 418/2011

28ÿå Dec 2011

[!Israeli Soldier Unleashes Army Dog on 47-year-old Woman <image:2790>](https://www.alhaq.org/cached_uploads/resize/1700/1200/alhaq_files/images/stories/Images/Israeli-Army-Attack-with-Dog.jpg "Israeli Soldier Unleashes Army Dog on 47-year-old Woman")

![Israeli-Army-Attack-with-Dog](/cached_uploads/resize/400/200/alhaq_files/images/stories/Images/Israeli-Army-Attack-with-Dog.jpg "An archived photo for illustration purposes of an Israeli army dog attacking  a Palestinian woman during an army raid in the West Bank village of Obadiyah, near Bethlehem. During last week, a woman and her 17-year-old son were attacked during an arrest operation.

### Amira Rahman ‚ÄòAwad

On 21 December, Israeli occupying forces unleashed an army dog on 47-year-old Amira Rahman ‚ÄòAwad during a raid on her sons‚Äô house in Ithna, Hebron. In some cases, computers, documents and money are ‚Äúconfiscated‚Äù and furniture is destroyed.

House raids are also used by Israel as tactics of harassment, as was the case during the week of 14 ‚Äì 20 November when the Israeli army raided the houses of Palestinian ex-prisoners to let them know they were being watched. The soldiers then called on Amira‚Äôs 17-year-old son Jarallah who went inside the house to put more clothes on.

Moments after the door to the house was wide open, the Israeli soldiers let loose an army dog described by Amira as being big and similar looking to a wolf. His demands were dismissed and no names were given to him.

Amira‚Äôs son Samer was released the next day at around 3:30 pm.

[20ÿå May 2025\
\
Urgent International Action Needed to Stop the Ongoing, Escalating and Irreversible Genocidal Violence in Gaza](https://www.alhaq.org/advocacy/26427.html)

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
Middle East Eye published an article on January 6, 2025, about an Israeli combat dog attack on a pregnant Palestinian woman, Tahrir Husni al-Arian, in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip. The attack, which occurred in late October 2023, caused severe injuries and complications, leading to the loss of her newborn baby. The article includes a photograph of the woman and her daughter. <image:i> The article also mentions the use of dog-mounted cameras by the Israeli military.

Another incident, reported by Middle East Eye on January 6, 2025, involved a pregnant woman, Tahrir Husni al-Arian, in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, in late October 2023, which resulted in the loss of her baby.
